Have you ever wondered what it's like to be an archeologist? An archeologist must be very careful when doing his or her job. There are many tools that archeologists use in their work to get the job done, and archeologists find more artifacts each day.

 

   The tools that an archeologist uses are very important. One of the most common tools used is a trowel. Trowels are used to scrape, cut, and view the layers of soil. Another tool used is a knife. Knives are used to cut dirt from around an artifact. A pick and shovel is also a tool that archeologists use. Most archeologists start digging with these.

 

  There are more tools archeologists use, also. For instance, they use whisks and dustpans. Whisks and dustpans are to brush off dirt from artifacts and excavation sites. Archeologists use wheelbarrows, too. Wheelbarrowsare used to carry off items or dirt to one place to another. Another tool used is a skim shovel. They have very flat edges that can carefully scope away dirt. These tools are not the only tools that archeologists use, there are still many, many more!

 

   There are many duties an archeologist must do, aswell. At an excavation site called Ferry Farms, groups of archeologists have been finding artifacts from George Washington's house! At Ferry Farms, there is at least thirty- five archeologists in one group. That's a lot of people! One group of archeologists will scope out an area by using 3D computers to see what's underground. Then they record the information so people will know what to expect when they start digging in that area. Another team focuses on digging, they call the place where they do the digging a dig.

 

  The teams at Ferry Farms have found kitchens, slave quarters, and storage houses in 2004. Later, they found the main farmhouse. They also found pieces of burnt pottery and parts of clay pipes. Still today Ferry Farms is finding more and more artifacts from long ago.

 

   In 1994, a group of archeologists that called themselves the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The project was made to find James Fort. People said that the fort had been washed away, but the project found clues that the fort was still around.

 

   The National Park Service studied the area that was the exact place the fort had been built for five years. they tried to find out how the land was used. This helped them decide where to look for the fort. Soon after, James Fort was found! Marks on the ground showed where the walls had been, and there were also stone ledges that were built to hold cannons. Cellars, burial sites, and buildings were all found by the archeologists. Today, the group finds about one million artifacts a year!

An archeologist is a person who finds artifacts about people or things from the past. So to find artifacts you must have the following tools used by archeologists: A pick and a shovel which most digs start with these two tools and there used to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts. Some other tools archeologists use would be a whisk and dustpan which is used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site. Also a knife is used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts, A wheelbarrow is used to move items from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the excavation site. Also a skim shovel is a shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop. Now this tool would be probably the most common tool an archeologist would use which is a trowel and it is used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil. These are the tools archeologists used while finding artifacts.

There are many jobs to figure out what happened in history and an archeologist is a very important one.  Archeologists have a pretty complicated job, like they have many teams.  Sometimes the teams can have up to 35 people.  Being an archeologist is hard because you have many jobs to do and it will be very confusing with all the people running around.  These next few paragraphs will about the tools they use.

         This first paragraph will be about a pick and a shovel and what their job is.  A pick is a very sharp tool that is used for to make a better hole to dig up.  A shovel is kinda the same but it is more round and it makes a deeper hole so its easier to find the artifact.  These are two tools that are useful to archeologists in team 1.

          This second paragraph is about a whisk and a dustpan and what their job is.  A whisk is a metal brush that brushes dirt off the artifact to make the artifact easier to see.  A dustpan is a metal pan with a handle on one side and dirt can go into it so the dust doesn't go back onto the artifact.  These two tools are very important to team 2 because if dirt is still on the artifact then the scanning wont be correct.

           This third paragraph is about a knife and a wheelbarrow and what their job is.  A knife is a very sharp tool that is used for careful digging and to scrape dirt away from around the artifacts.  A wheelbarrow is like a big bucket on wheels and is used to move items from one place to anther or to carry dirt away from the excavation site. These tools are very important tools.

            This fourth paragraph is about a skim shovel and a trowel and what they do.  A skim shovel is a shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop.  A trowel is a sharp hand held shovel that is probably the most common tool in archeology. It's used for scraping and cutting to view the different layers of soil. These to tools are most common and most used while an archeologist is working.

              There are many jobs in order to be an archeologist so that's why there are so many tools to help dig up artifacts so that people who want to know about people they can. This was my report on what an archeologists job is for and what is does and how they do it.

Archeology

 

Archeology is a difficult job. You need many different tools to go digging for artifacts. Also, you can't dig up an artifact overnight. It takes a lot of work. Archeologists have to map out the area that they want to dig and use 3D computers to track what's underground. Being an archeologist is no piece of cake, but you can benefit in many ways.

 

Once on the digging site, archeologists use many different kinds of tools to find what they are looking for. Skim shovels are used to take off a very small layer of dirt with each dig. Picks and shovels are used to dig deep to find artifacts. Knives are used to scrape dirt off artifacts and to do careful digging.Trowels are used to view the different layers of soil at a digging site. Whisks are used to brush away extra dirt, and wheelbarrows are used to move artifacts from one place to another.

 

Archeology isn't a walk in the park, but without it we would not know a lot about the past and the hardships that people went through. Not much would be known about anything! Without archeology, we would know nothing about our ancestors, so get out there and start digging!

Finding Fort James

 

   In 1994 a group of people were studying the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. They were trying to find the secrets of James Fort in Jamestown Virginia. Over 200 years people thought that the fort was washed away by a river

 

    The fort was built in 1607 when the settlers came from there home town of England for a new life. They thought that Jamestown was by a river so it would be easier to dock ships. They found objects nearby suggesting that the fort was farther away. It was probably for protection from enemy ships.

 

   The first object they found were in 1861. Archeologists found armor and weapons.  they also discover floors of buildings. 100 years later they were trying to find the exact spot were the fort was built. The National park service led 5 years of studying the area to figure out how they used the land. The people used computer mapping software to make the image of the area.

 

  Then they found James Fort. The first thing they found were a set of marks on the ground. They made maps and found out that reached all the way to a river. The ledges were soposed to hold canons. The archeologists found eleven cellars, dozens of burial sites, and ten huge buildings all within the fort.

 

  Today the find almost 1 million objects a year. The objects are pottery, tools,coins,and even metal toys for the kids. In 1600's people throw their trash down an unused well or pit. While digging in the area the archaeologists found trash that the settlers threw away including bones of animals that they ate. They uderstand how the people at the fort lived. They know how they fought the Powhatan tribe that often attacked them. also how they survived the difficult years when they had little food.

My Report

 

           In 1994 a group interested in studying the past started to study Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The project was to uncover secrets of James Fort located in Jamestown, Virginia. For over 200 year, people thought that the fort had been washed away by river. Some discoveries hinted that it might still exist.

 

           The National Park Service led a five-year study of the area to figure out how and when the land was used. The people studying used computer mapping software to make an image of the historical area, so they could picture where this all happened.

 

 

           That's when they finally found James Fort! It was amazing! First, they found a set of marks on the ground.those marks showed were the fort's walls used to be. Archeologists knew that the fort would be a triangle due to all the stories they heard, all the drawings they had seen, all the paintings and many more.

 

           Today, groups find nearly 1 million objects every year! Those objects include pottery, tools, coins and even toys made of metal for children. In the 1600's people used to throw their trash in a unused well or a big pit.

 

           It is so exciting to discover objects that were regularly used by people who lived hundreds of years ago. It gives us a piece of the past, how our ancestors lived and how America started as a very young country.

                         A Pick and Shovel are usually the most common

thing anyone can use. If you were an archeologist, you would use

these first if you found a spot to dig. these two tools dig into the earth to find the artifacts. If you get lucky and find an object, you'll notice that it's all dirty and dusty. This is where the whisk and dustpan come to the rescue. They are used to brush the artifact and clean away the sand and dirt. A knife isn't that important, so I'm not going to say a lot about it. The knife is only used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifact. If you have al lot of stuff, then a wheelbarrow is the perfect thing. A wheelbarrow is used for carrying stuff and taking the left over dirt to a different location. A skim shovel is used to carefully remove thin layers of soil with each scoop. Although, I said a pick and shovel are the most common thing, its actually the trowel which is the most common tool. it's used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil. Now that I told you everything I could, I hope you will want learn more about being an archeologist

Finding Artifacts Preparation Guide

                                                       by Juan Diaz

 

           If you are an archeologists and is going out to find historical artifacts, you'll need to prepare your trip.When you going to find artifacts you'll need to have the right tools for the job.If you bring the wrong tools, you may be in trouble.Just make sure you have food and water if your artifact finding trip will take at least a day or two.

 

                                     The other tools you'll need are:

                                     (1) A pick and a shovel

                                      You'll need to dig in to find artifacts.

                                       It wont just be lying on the ground.

 

                                      (2) A whisk and dustpan.

                                       Some of the most important parts of

                                       the artifact may be covered with dirt or sand.

                                       Use these to get the dirt and sand off.

 

                                       (3) A knife

                                        Usually used for digging a little bit of dirt or sand

                                         off of an artifact.

 

                                        (4) Wheelbarrow

                                        Can be used for carrying the artifact if can't be carried

                                         by hand.

 

                                         (5) Skim Shovel

                                          A shovel hat can scoop up a thin layer of dirt, sand, or soil.

 

                                         (6) Trowel

                                         This tool can scrap and cut different kind of layers of soil,

                                         This tool is the most used tool by archeologists.

 

              Now that you have you're tools, it's time to find artifacts.But you need to make sure that you are in the right place to find the correct artifact.You'll also need a compass to help you find you're way around the area you're in.Make sure to dug deep enough if it's underground.But just be careful not to dig too deep or you'll reach the Earth's Core.

 

              Also, you'll need to make sure if you can get back above ground or you'll be in trouble indeed.Now you know you'll have to be prepared for the trip,what tools you need, and what to watch out for.Now if you are ready to find an artifact, just make sure you double check if you have everything you need.

The job of archeologist can be very hard because it can be hard having very many people with you.The first team uses 3D devices that can see under ground.The information is recorded so that people can see what it looks like before they dig it up.The archeologists start their digging with a tool called skim shovels,these shovels are so small,flat,and sharp they can remove thin layers of soil ,one at a time.That soil is then placed in a box with a half inch screen at the bottom,this lets the soil fall out and the artifacts stay in.  

         Troweling is when archeologists use small shovels,paint brushes,and woodenpicks to remove dirt.It can take up to two weeks to dig up a 25-square-foot section. For History Day, I am doing my report on archeologist.  Archeologist are people who study things from the past, they might dig holes and look for valuable objects, for example a dinosaur bone. 

 

Some of the archeologist that I researched were studying James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia.  The fort was built in 1607 when the settlers came from England to start a new life in the new Americas.  Some people thought that the fort was built near the river but the archeologist found weapons and armour farther away. 

 

Finally the archeologist found the fort.  The fort had triangle walls that stretched all the way to the river.  There were ten different buildings, lots of burial sites, and cellars. 

 

Today the group finds nearly 1 million objects each year. The objects are pottery tools, metal tools. Because of the archeologist we know that the settlers attacked the Powhatan Indians.  It was exciting for the archeologist to find all the things that the Indians and the settlers used.

 

Another group of archeologist that I studied researched George Washington's house and looked for valuable things that George Washington used.  They knew it was George's house because the house had a clay pipe in it and he smoked clay pipes. 

 

The different tools that the archeologist use to find objects in George Washington's house are a skim shovel, a throwel, 3D computer, and a half inch screen box. The skim shovel is used for the actual digging.  A throwel is used for digging 25 square foot holes, which can take up to two weeks to finish.  The 3D computer is used for tracking whats underground.  The half inch screen box is used to hold the soil.

Have you ever seen the movies of Indiana Jones? Well, those movies are about a college professor who also happens to be an archeologist. He goes on crazy missions looking for lost riches. But no, an archeologist is not someone who goes to exotic places and find secret rooms and burial chambers.

 

   The definition of an archeologist a scientist who studies the past. It's kind of like a historian, except historians read the books about life in the past. As for archeologists, they are there to get dirty. All they want is information about the past. And, to make a difference, people don't sit down. No sir, they get up and make a difference. They do travel to interesting places, but not to relax. Oh no, they are there to discover the past, comparing life now and then.

 

   Some of the things they want to figure out is how people lived back in time, what were some of the daily materials and items they used, their techniques for building, farming, cooking, and other stuff like that. The first step in archeology is not to know who the people they are studying are, but where they lived. For example, the archeologists who wanted to study Jamestown, thought that the area where the colonists from Jamestown lived, had been washed away by a river. But that rumor didn't stop them from investigating. Only a true archeologist would prove it to themselves.

 

   And lucky they decided to prove it to themselves, or archeologists wouldn't have found all the amazing artifacts in the area where people believed Jamestown had once stood. Some of the things they  dug out of the ground include uncovered armor, weapons, floors of buildings, eleven cellars, tons of burial grounds, ten crumbled buildings, pottery, tools, coins, and even metal toys for children! As for George Washington's land where he lived, it did take some time to do, but they did find the Washington's land. They found the kitchen, slave quarters, storage houses, and later on the main farmhouse. Archeologists also have to do research, like when they needed to know if the buildings they found on Washingtons land was their house. So, they found records that showed that the Washingtons had a fire in the house, which mached the burnt pottery they found, and that was proof enough.

 

  Archeologists have to use may different tools to do their job, like a pick and shovel, whisk and dustpan, knife, wheelbarow, skim shovel and trowels. It is a slow process, and you must have patience, but in the end of a discovery, you are a hero to be an american, by knowing so much about our countries past. And that, my friend, is the life of a true archeologist.

A Job as an Archeologist

 

By Maddy Roelofs

 

      Have you ever wondered how we know so much about well-known people's pasts? Well, if you want to know, I'll tell you a little bit about working as an archeologist. First things first. What is an archeologist?

      An archeologist is a person who tries to find artifacts that famous people from the past, like George Washington, used. Then, they study the artifacts to find more information about that person and their life as a child. Archeologists don't work by themselves, they work in groups.These groups are called teams. There are many teams working on one site and can be up to 35 people on a team. Each team works on something different. One team uses 3D computers that can track things underground to map out the area. This way, people know where to start digging. The second group does the actual digging. They use special tools to help them. For example, the skim shovel is a small, flat, sharp shovel which they use to remove thin layers of soil. After, the soil is put in a box with a screen at the bottom so the soil will fall through and the artifacts will stay in. The last team studies the artifacts in a lab for days. It takes a long time to complete the process of digging and studing the objects but helps us understand more about well-known people!

      Overall, a job as an archeologist would be tiring but you would also find some cool artifacts from history and learn more about famous people from the past!

Archeologists!

 

 

Have you ever wondered what it was like to live long ago? If so you might want to consider a job as an archeologist. This job presents an opportunity to learn all sorts of things about famous people who came before you.

 

       An archeologist's job is very important. They devote their time to finding out more about the lives and families of famous people that we don't know much about. For example, we knew little about where Gorge Washington grew up, until archeologists excavated the Ferry Farm site. While we knew much about his time as a soldier and president, as well as his life at his family home at Mount Vernon archeologists made it possible to know what he experienced as a child. this is important because his child life influenced many of the important decisions he made.

 

        Another example is the dig site at Fort James. a lot of people thought that it was swept away by the river, but recent discoveries suggest otherwise. A group of devoted archeologists spent many weeks excavating a huge amount of land that led to recent discoveries at the site of Fort James.

      

         While many people thought that the inner buildings of the fort were close to the river, so it would be easier to dock ships archeologists have discovered that they were located further away for protection from enemy ships. they have also discovered what remains of a stone wall that would have held cannons to ward off intruders.

 

          These discoveries have made it possible to learn many things about the Fort and the people who lived in it. They couldn't have done it without their tools, though. To give you a better idea of what the archeologists would have used to ,make these important discoveries here is a run down of the tools for you.

 

           They would start with a skim shovel to take off the thin levels of to soil, and to locate the artifacts that were left close to the surface. Then they would use regular shovels to pick up dirt to drop into a half inch screen, that let the dirt fall out, but left the artifacts in. Next they would load the dirt into a wheelbarrow to be moved to a different site to be examined for any small artifacts that slipped through holes in the screen.  someone will then bring the artifacts to a lab where groups of scientists will spend weeks looking over them, and figuring out what they mean. They then use trowels to cut soil samples to be examined by soil scientists. There are many other tools, but these are the main ones. They have to be so careful digging that it can take over two weeks to clear a twenty-five foot section!

 

           Now that you know about the many trials and rewards that make up the job of an archeologist, think about it. We should really be thankful that there are people out there that are devoted enough to take time away from their families to make the important discoveries that they do. Do you think that you have the diligence to become one?

The Life Of An Archeologist

By: Lily Marie Murray

 

     Have you ever wondered what the life of an archeologist would be? The life of an archeologist is hard and interesting too! Long hours, lots of digging and searching for where these places are.  Sometimes it takes more than a year or two to find the place, such as Fort James. They had to dig underground to find where it was! Usually, it is totally worth it. Finding new things about different people and places. Like their childhood, history, lives, learn how they became famous, what decisions they made, what type of life they had, and much, much more.

 

     One of there projects was Finding Fort James. For more than 200 years, everyone thought that it had been washed away by some river near by. Some say, there are some discoveries in the area said it might still be around. The fort was built in 1607. That was when English settlers came to start a new life. The first objects that were found was in 1861. They uncovered armor and weapons. Then, they found what they were looking for.......the floors of the buildings. Over about 100 years later, a group was trying to find the exact spot where the fort was first built and where it began! 

    

     The National Park Service helped construct a five year study of the area to find how all of the land was used and what could be built on it. They did this because they wanted proof that the fort was still here. People who helped with the study used special computer mapping software to make images of the area, maybe sort of like an X-ray. They finally found it! They found cellars to burial sites to buildings and much, much, more! Today, the group has found and dug up more than 1 million objects each year! They found pottery, tools, coins, and metal toys for kids!

 

     One of the other projects they did was the past on Ferry Farm. Ferry Farm has been known for over 12,000 years. People have lived on Ferry Farm but do you know the most famous person that lived there?  Well, it was George Washington himself. He moved there with his family when he was six years old. No one knows exactly where they lived because the house is long gone. Archeologists think it is still there. They started digging in 2003. It took over a year , but of course they found it. They first found kitchens, slave quarters, and storage houses. Then, they finally found the main farmhouse a couple years later.

 

     There were at least four other houses that were built on that land, so they needed to find the proof that this was George Washington's House for sure. The records showed that they had a fire in that house. What did they find? Burnt pottery! They also found a part of a clay pipe! Washington smoked clay pipes. After that, they knew that this was their house and there was a fire in the house.

 

     How do you think the archeologists find this stuff in Washington's house? Well, it was a careful one. you could tell they were a pretty rich family from all the pottery and expensive stuff. They had several groups. The groups consists of 35 people at least on every team. One team maps the area using 3D computers that tracks what is underground. This is helpful so that the diggers know where to dig for the object and what it looks like.

 

     Another team does the digging part. They are called the dig. They use a lot of tools. Let me describe them for you.


Pick and Shovel-Most digs start with these two tools. Used to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts.
Whisk and Dustpan-Used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site.
Knife-Used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts.
Wheelbarrow-Used to move items from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the excavation site.
Skim Shovel-A shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop.
Trowel-Probable the most common tool in archeology. Used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.
Citation: Information from passage Tools Used by Archeologists

Archeologists

      By: Baylee West

 

 

     Archeologists are people who study objects from the past. They use Picks, Shovels, Whisks, dustpans, Knives, Wheelbarrows, Skim Shovels, and a Trowel. There can be up to thirty-five people on a team.

    

     The first team can map the area by using 3D computers that people can track whats under ground. The information is recorded so that people will know what the item looks like before the archeologists start digging.

    

     Another team has to focus on the actual digging, and the place were the team does the digging is called a Dig. The archeologists start to dig with a skim shovel. Skim shovels are so flat, small, and sharp that they can only remove thin layers of soil. That soil is then placed in a box with a half-inch screen at the bottom. This lets the soil fall out while the the artifacts stay in.

    

     The diggers also use a process called troweling. Troweling is when archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove soil. It can take up to, two weeks to dig a twenty-five square foot section! The next team spends days and days in the lab studying the objects that are found. The whole process is slow and tiresome.

    

           And that's the job of an Archeologist.

The job of an archeologist is a carefully planned out job that requires patients, skill, and precision.  I shall explain what the job of an archeologist is like.  This will include how they find an area and what they find in the area that they plan to dig up.  It will also explain how they dig up an area and tools that they use.

 

    Before the archeologists start excavating, they need to plan out and map the area they plan to dig up.  Using 3D computers, they can track what is underground.  This helps them see what the area was like before they started digging.  They try to make sure what they're going to excavate is still there by researching the area, but they still may not find what they wanted to find.  After this is done, they have to fly, drive, or sail to that area to begin the excavating process.

 

    Once they are at the site, they begin to remove dirt by the process of troweling or using skim shovels to remove small pieces of dirt.  The work is very slow.  Once some objects are found they  brush dirt off them by using a whisk and dustbin.  Then, workers place them in a wheelbarrow to move them to another place. When the objects arrive, they are carefully studied for days.

 

    Some things archeologists find may not mean much, such as a pair of broken scissors.  Some objects could help us learn more about someone or something.  If the object is a dinosaur bone it could help us discover a new species of dinosaur.   If they uncovered a brick in the desert, it could have been the brick from a pyramid.  Objects found from a famous person could change they way we look at him/her.

 

    The job of an archeologist is a job in which you will sometimes not find what you are looking for.  You cannot let your hopes get too high, or you may be disappointed when you do not find want you wanted to.  It is also a rewarding job, considering what you find is an important object in history.  It is a job that can go either way, and can be disappointing and rewarding.  Overall, the job requires lots of patience, accuracy, and skill.

In 1994, a group of  people started studying the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaelogical Project. It was designed to discover secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia. For over 200 years, people thought that the fort had been washed  away

by a river. Some discoveries in the area hinted that it might still be around.The fort was built in 1607 when settlers came from England

to start anew life.

Most believed that James Fort was built near a river. It was easier to dock ships there, so it made sense that the settlers would

choose that spot. However, objects found nearby suggested the fort was further away. The new spot probably gave the settlers

more protection from enemy ships. The first objects were found in 1861. Archeoligists, the name for scientist who study objects

frome the past, uncovered armor and weapons. They also discovered the floors of buildings. Over 100 years later, a group effort

to find the exact spot where the fort was built began.

 

The National Park Service led a five-year study of the area to figure out how the land was used. They knew that this would

help them decide where to look for proof of the fort.The people doingthe study used computer mapping software to make

an image of the area.Thats when they finally found James Fort!

An Archeologist is a someone uncovered armor and weapons.Today also find cellars,dozens of burial sites,and ten buildings all within the border of the fort.One day they found nearly 1 million each yaer, and found this object include pottery, tools, coins, and even metal toys puters that can track what is underground.The information is recorded so that peopple will know what it looked like before poeple started digging.

 

 

 

          Archeologist use many tools.Another team focuses on the actual digging,and the place the team does the digging is called a dig.Those archheologists start their dig with what are called skim shovels.These shovels are so small, flat, and sharp that they can remove thin layers of soil, one at a time. That soil is then placed in a box with a half-inch screen at the bottom.This lets the  dirt fall out while the artifacts stay in The diggers also use a process called troweling.Teoweling is when archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes, anh wooden picks to remove dirt.

Archeologists are very important people who help us discover the ways of living in the past, events that might've happened in the past, and to give people a better understanding of our world's history. What exactly is an archeologist? Well an archeologist is a person who spends there time in search of digging up artifacts from the past whether it is old pottery pieces, armor, weapons, tools, coins, or metal toys for children.                                                                                                

 

          You can't expect pottery from thousands of years ago to be in one whole piece, so if an archeologist is lucky enough to find all the pieces from pottery they most likely will spend their time gluing all the pieces together to discover more of what type of pottery people in the past made. Being an archeologist requires a lot of time and patience because you might not always find what you are looking for right away.

 

          How do archeologists find artifacts from the past? Well, each year many teams will work on a site where they're trying to find information. There can be up to 35 people on a team! One of the teams maps out the site using 3D computers that can track what is underground. The team that is digging can use the map that the 3D computers show so that they can know what it looks like underground before they start digging. The area the digging team does the digging is called a dig. The archeologists in this group start their dig by using Skim Shovels. That soil that they scoop up is then placed in a box with a half screen at the bottom. The half screen lets the dirt fall out while the artifacts stay in. The diggers also use a process called troweling which is when archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove dirt. Another team spends days in the lab studying the artifacts that were found. It takes a lot of people working together to discover our worlds past.

 

         Archeologists use many tools to discover all these artifacts. As I mentioned earlier the group that does the digging uses a skim shovel. A skim shovel has a flat edge that is used to carefully remove a thin layer of soilwith each scoop. Another tool that the archeologists use is a pick and shovel which is a tool that most digs start with. The pick and shovel is used to dig into the earth, close to the objects. There are many tools that are used to brush away the dirt off of an artifact. One of those tools is a whisk and a dustpan. A whisk and a dustpan can also be used to clear away dirt from the excavation center. A knife also can be used to scrape away the dirt around an artifact. A knife can also be used for careful digging. A wheelbarrow is used to move items from one place to another, but can also be used like the whisk and dustpan to carry dirt away from the excavation site. The most common tool and archeologist uses is a trowel. A trowel is used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of the soil. Archeologists use many tools to make their job a whole lot easier and accurate.

 

           Archeologists jobs are long, tiresome, and hard. It can take up to 2 weeks to dig a 25 square foot section. All those weeks add up when you are digging up a large space. It's definitely true that it takes time to actual dig up and discover the objects but to add on top of that, the time that it will take to study the objects, find out what they mean, and use other bits of information to tie in to the object that they had found. Archeologists must take their time and have patience to truly discover, enjoy, and appreciate what they have found.

 

          It is important, meaningful, and exciting for us to discover about our worlds past, and it's hard to do that without any kind of proof. These artifacts that our archeologists find show us the objects that were regularly used by people many years ago. All the artifacts in museums had to be discovered one way or another and they were dug up by archeologists! These artifacts give us a piece of our past and ties us to the the people who lived back then. These artifacts give us a better understanding of the United States past. The job of an archeologist is super important! We get to learn why a certain person made a certain decision from the objects they left behind. Without archeologists we wouldn't know any of this information and would be clueless. I hope you now understand why an archeologist's job is so significant! JAMESTOWN FORT   

 

 

     In 1994 a large group of people became interested in studying the past of Jamestown. So they made a project called Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The project was formed to find the secerts of James Fort in Jamestown Virginia. For over 200 years people thought that the fort had been washed away by a river. Some discoveries in the area had hinted that it might still be around.

 

     The Fort was built in 1607. The settelers came to England to start a new life. Some people thought that James Fort was built near a river. The first oblects were found in 1861. Archaeologists the name for sciancetists who study objects from the past, undiscovered armor, weapons, and the floor of buildings. Over 100 years later a group effort to find the exact spot where the fort was built began. The National Park Service led a 5 year study to find out how the land was used.The people doing the study used computer mapping software to make an image of the area. 

 

     Thats when they finally found James Fort! The first thing they found was a set of markes on the ground the marks showed where the walls used to be they knew that the fort was shaped like a tringal. Altoget her the group has found nearly 1 million objects from the fort.

Finding Fort James

      

       In 1994, many people felt like studying the past. They started Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The project was created to find the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia. Many investigations in that place hinted that it can still be around. Over 200 years, people were thinking that the fort was washed away by a river.

 

        The fort was constructed in 1607 when people went from England to here. They did that so they can launch a new life. Many people believed that James Fort was built by the river. It was more simple to put ships there. So it had made sense that they would want to pick that spot. Things that  were found close by suggested that the fort was more far away. The new place probably went to give the people several more protection from bad ships.                                                                                                                                 

 

         The objects that were found first were discovered in 1861. Archeologists found out about the floors of constructing. Past 100 years, a team effort to discover the same place where the fort  constructed had began. They were the Archeologists.

 

          They had finally found James when people were doing the study used computer searching software to make an image of the area. The object that they found first was a bunch of marks on the floor. The marks had showed where the fort's walls had been before. During all the stories that had been heard and read, and pictures they they had constructed, the archeologists found out that  the fort would look like a triangle. They constructed maps and discovered that the fort expanded all the way to the lake. Then the learned there were rock ledges constructed  past the lake. The ledges were created to hold things. The archeologists had also discovered eleven cellars, 12 of burial sites, and ten buildings within all the borden of the fort.

The Job of an Archeologist

 

                                        

                   The job of an archeologist is to find ancient artifacts and valuables. They use many different tools such as,Pick and shovel, Whisk and Dustpan, A knife, Wheelbarrows, Skim shovels, And Trowels. But to get to work an arheologist needs to know what their looking for. Like, facts about Abraham Lincoln, Elvis Presley's guitar, or anything else that can tell us about the past.

             First,(after they know what they want to find)they have to find a place to look for the item.To do this they use computer mapping software to make an image of the area. From that image archeologists can find clues such as marks,debris etc. After they find the area, they send in teams of 10-35 people. to use computers to find artifacts underground, and to dig out the area to find the mapped items. Finally, they use the artifact to tell them more about history.

It started in 1994 when a group of people became interested in studying things from the past. The group was called the Jamestown Rediscovery Arcaeological Project. The fort was built in 1607 when the English settlers arrived in North America to start a new life. The fort was originally built near the river. They decided to move to a new spot where they'd have more protection from enemies and their ships. The first objects were found in 1861. In this report you will be learning about the job of an archeologist. Archeologists find information about people in the past who are not living now. Some people might think their job is easy and some people think it is hard. It is just your opinion but i think their job is hard because sometimes it takes you a long time to really find any artifacts. In these paragraphs you will learn about what tools they use, how they use them, and what they do.

     The tools that archeologists use are picks and shovels, a whisk and dustpan, a knife, wheelbarrows, skim shovels, and a trowel. Most digs start with picks and shovels. They are used to dig into the ground and find the artifacts they are looking for. A whisk and a dustpan are used to brush the dirt off of artifacts. A knife is used to dig carefully and scrape dirt off of the artifacts. A wheelbarrow is used to move artifacts from one place to another. Skim shovels are shovels with a flat edge used to remove a very thin layer of dirt carefully. The last tool that an archeologist uses is a trowel. Trowels are used to scrape and cut the dirt to view the different layers of dirt.

     Archeologists find artifacts by digging for long periods of time. They have to plan how to and where to dig before they start digging for real. Sometimes they use a 3D computer to track and map what is underground. Some archeologists just start digging in the first place and see what they find. If they use a 3D computer to map the area out they have to record the information of where to dig so they know what the artifact looks like before they start digging. If they are focusing on the actual digging, they start with skim shovels. Archeologist then put the little layers of soil dug up in boxes with half-inched screens on the bottoms. This lets soil go through the screen and leaves back artifacts.

     This report was about the job of an archeologist. Now you know what type of tools they use and how they use them. It takes a few years sometimes to finish an area.If I wrote this report again I would write it about how archeologists earn their job. Since I learned more about being an archeologists I believe it would be fun to have this job.

     First in 1994 a group of people got together so they could study the past of  James Fort in Jamestown. They wanted to set up an archaeological project. archeologists found weapons, and armor.One hundred years after that they found some more. Now we have found over 1 millon things, including pots, coins, toys, and tools.

The Job of an Archeologist

 

                                                                by Isabella Yu

 

 

  Have you ever heard of an archeologist? An archeologist is a person who discovers and digs up artifacts, items of the past, and fossils. Archeologists can use special tools to help them discover artifacts and fossils. They also have a procedure and they can dig up certain items.

 

  Some tools that archeologists use are picks, shovels, whisks, dustpans, knives, wheelbarrows, skim shovels, and trowels. The pick and shovel are used to dig up the soil above where something might be. The whisk and dustpan are used to brush off dust and dirt. Wheelbarrows were used to move dirt or items to another place. A skim shovel is used to remove very thin layers of soil. The trowel scrapes and cuts layers of soil.

 

  To dig up artifacts in a certain area, a team of archeologists first map out a place to find out what is underground. Then, another group of archeologists do the actual digging for items in the area that is mapped out. They use the skim shovel to remove layers of soil to find items. Archeolgists use another method called troweling too. troweling uses shovels, brushes, and picks to remove dirt. After the artifacts are found, another team of archeologists studies the objects that the second team found.

 

  Most things archeologists will find are artifacts and the fossilized bones of animals. Archeologists can find ancient pottery, paintings, metal items, tombs, and toys. If archeologists are searching for fossils, they can find the remains of dinosaurs and long-ago plants and animals. There are some places that are good sources of fossils and artifacts, such as the La Brea Tar Pits in Southern California, or the Egyptian pyramids.

 

  Being an archeologist can be fun, but it can also be dull and tiring, especially if you can not find anything. But if an archeologist finds something fascinating, like King Tut's coffin, he/she could become world renowned. Archeology is an interesting subject.

Being an archeologist means digging and discovering things that are underground. Archeologists use shovels, picks, whisk and dustpans, knifes, wheelbarrows, skim shovels, and trowels. Shovels and picks, which is like a pickaxe, are used for digging, they're the main digging tools. Whisks and dustpans are like little brushes and dustpans, they are used for brush dirt off of artifacts and to clear dirt away. Knives as an archeology tool aren't used the same way as normal knives. They're used to scrape dirt from around the artifacts. Wheelbarrows

move dirt from one place to another. Skim shovels are a type of shovel that have a flat edge. Can be used to carfully remove a thin layer of soil. Trowels are one of the most used tools, they are used to scrape and cut to view different layers of soil.

The job of an archeologist is very important.  They find things from the past so we can learn about it.  They could help us learn about one person, and that discovery could help us learn about other people as well.

  Archeologists will often find an artifact that can tell us about several things, like what life was like then, or what a person might have done.

  Things that they find may inspire some people or lead to ideas for new inventions.  Things that they find could help someone be creative.

  Archeologists help us learn new things about a time or person, or inspire a person to create an invention.

Pick & Shovel: Most digs start  with these two tools.Used to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts. Whisk & Dustpan: Used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away form the dirt from the excavation site. Knife: Used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts. Wheelbarrow: Used to move items from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the excavation site. Skim Shovel: A shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer soil with each scoop. Trowel: Probably the most common tool in archeology. Used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.

Being An Archeologist

   Being an archeologist can be a tough job. Spending weeks on end digging. But, it can also be a fun job. Like when you find ancient burrial grouds or maybe a tomb with an egytian phero in it. That's always exciting. Well, here are some other amazing digs that made the job worth-while.

  

   In 1994, some people interested in the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archeological Project. They wanted to find the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia. For 200 years, everyone thought the fort had been taken by the river. But some things found in the area hinted that it might still be there. The fort was made in 1607, at the same time the English Settlers came. The first objects were found in 1861. Archeologists discovered armor and weapons. They also found the floors of buildings.

 

   About 100 years later, a group set out to find the exact spot where the fort had been built. The people diong the study used computer mapping to create a picture of the area. And that's when they found James Fort! The first thing they found were marks on the ground. They showed where the walls used to be. From everything they had researched, they knew the fort would be triangle shaped. They also found that it streched to the river. Today the archeologists find about 1 million objects every year!

 

   Now you can see why being an archeologist is so fun. I mean, they found a whole forrt! Well, I hope you enjoyed.

An Archeologist's Job

 

 

     The job of an archeologist is an intresting job. They get to see all the artifacts that they get,but its a lot of work to find the artifacts,too. Let me explain what I mean.
     First of all,they have to get all the research and then get the tools. They have to get things from 3D computers to dust pans. They also have teams to make it easier. The teams can be up to thirty five people! They also have to find out about other things that were found in the area to see if what their trying to find is still there. Then they start the hunt.

Digging For History

 

      Finding Fort James

                  Archeologists have been studying Jamestown in 1994.

            They have been discovering the secrets of James Fort in             Jamestown, Virginia. People thought that the fort had been             washed away by a river. Some discoveries found in the area

            hinted that it might still be around there.

              

 

                 James Fort was built  in 1607, that's when the settlers                      came from England. It was easier for people to dock ships                  there. The settlers found objects that meant the fort was                        further away from where they were. So they moved away,                   and the new spot gave more protection to the settlers from                   enemy ships.

 

 

                  The first objects were found in 1861. Archeologists                       uncovered armor and weapons from the past. They found                     other objects, such as, floors of buildings. Over 100 years                   later, a group of archeologists, found the exact spot where the             fort was built.

 

             

                  The National Park Service led a 5-year study of the area                to figure out how the area was used. They decided that this                 solution would help them look for evidence of the fort. Some               of the group did the computer mapping software of the area to              make an image of the  area.

 

 

                  They finally found James Fort! They found a set of marks                on the ground, they showed where the walls used to be. They              heared different stories, read books, and made drawings, the             archeologists knew that the fort would be shaped like a                       triangle. They found different objects such as:11 cellars,                     ledges, burial sites, and ten buildings.

 

                   So, do you want to be an archeologist?

What is it like to be a archeologist? your about to find out. A archeologist is a person that uses many tools to dig up different artifacts from many different locations. Those artifacts help us learn more about history. It is exiting to discover objects that were regularly used by people who lived hundreds of years ago.

   

     The process of digging is a careful one. It takes patience, and many hard workers. The many people who dig are on a "team." There can be up to thirty-five people on a team! The first team maps the area using 3D computers that can track what is underground.All the information is used to show where the workers need to start and what to use.

 

      Another type of team works on the actual digging. Where they dig, is called a "dig." they start with a tool called a "Skim shovel." The skim shovel is used to get the first few layers of dirt off. It can do this because of its shape. The skim shovel is is small, flat, and sharp.

 

        A technique called troweling is also a way to dig up artifacts. They archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes and wooden picks to remove the dirt off of the artifacts. Sometimes, it takes up to two weeks to dig a twenty-five square foot section. A different team from the two you have already learned about, spends a whole day examining artifacts in a lab.

 

           So, do you think your going to be a archeologist? Your going to have to be a patient and hard worker!

Archeologists

 

 

     In 1994, people were interested about studying the past.  The project was designed to discover the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia.  For over 200 years people thought the fort was washed away.  The fort was built in 1607 when English settlers came to start a new life.  ?????

 

     The first objects were found in 1861.  They uncovered armor and weapons.  Over 100 years later, a group tried to find the exact spot where the fort began.  They led a five-year study of the area to figure out how the land was used.  They knew that this would help them decide where to look for proof of the fort.

 

     That is where they finally found James Fort!  The first thing they found was a set of marks on the ground.  The marks showed where the fort's walls used to be.  between all the stories they heard, read, and drawings they made , the archeologists knew that the fort would be shaped like a triangle.

 

      Today, the group finds nearly 1,000,000,000 objects each year.  The objects include pottery, tools, coins, and even metal toys for children.  In the 1600's, people used to throw there trash down an unused well or into a big pit.

 

       It is exiting to discover objects that were regularly used by people who lived hundreds of years ago!  In my opinion archeologists are pretty cool people!

Have you ever wonder what an archeologists do? Archeologists are scientists who study object from the past. Archeologists use a lot of tools, and I will tell what they use in a minute.

     Tools archeologists use are pick and shovel, whisk and dustpan, knife, wheelbarrow, skim shovel, and trowel. All of them are used for digging up or cleaning artifacts

     Pick and shovel are probably the first tool archeologits use. The pick and shovel are use to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts.

     The whisk and dustpan are used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site, excavation means to get rid of something or someone.

     Knife is used also for digging, but carefully, and is also used to scrape dirt from around the artifacts.

     Wheelbarrow is used to move items from one place to another ot to carry dirt away from the excavation site.

     Skim shovel is a shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop.

     Trowel is the final tool I'm talking about and its probably the most common too for acheologists to use. The trowel is used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.

     I hope you enjoy knowing what archeologists' job is and what tool do they use.

Wheelbarrow-Used to move items from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the excavation site.

In 1994, a group of people interested in studying the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project.The project was designed to discover the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown Virginia.The fort was built in 1607 when settlers came from England to start a new life.Most believed that that James Fort was built by a river.It was easier to dock ships there, so it made sense that the settlers would choose that spot. So archeologists work on digging sites and find find artifacts. There is more to them then you think. This essay tells you how they work on digging sites, why they must be careful and patient while digging, and what benefits their digging. Remember there is more to archeologists then you think.

 

Archeologists are split up into teams. The first one of these teams map the area with three-dimensional computers. Those computers track what is underground so that the archeologists will know what the site looks like before they start digging. The second team does the actual digging. They start digging with a special shovel called a skim shovel which can remove a thin layer of dirt with each single scoop. Then the soil is put in a special container that has a 1/2 inch screen at the bottom that lets all of the dirt out at the bottom while the artifacts stay in. Then the archeologists use paint brushes, small shovels, and wooden toothpicks to remove dirt in a process called troweling. The final team studies the objects that were found on the site in a lab.

 

This whole process takes a long time, and you might want it to be over with. But you must be patient with your work! The people who dug up the site and found George Washington's house said that it took a year to find the slave quarters, kitchen, and storage houses. It took even longer to find the farmhouse. Plus, if you were not careful, you would dig right past the thing or place that you were trying to find.

 

But, something benefits all this hard work. When you do find what you were looking for it will teach you a little about world history. There is that and the fact that you discovered something that was lost in history for so many years. On top of that there is the joy of doing all that labor and it really pays off.

the school dircton are to have constration to the test and to have more time and to not rush the test and to have rite spelling and to have more corrcet question on the test of the cst and to have more ansewers correct.

The job of an archeologist is to study and learn about things that happend in the past or to study famous people like Goerge Washington.Also,their job is to study objects from the past.

    

In 1994,a group of people interested in studying the past started in Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project.The project was designed to discover the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown,Virginia.For over 200 years.people thought that the fort had been washed away by

a river.Some discoveries in the area hinted that it might still be around.                                       

The fort was built in 1607 when settlers came from England to start a new life.Most believed that James Fort was built near the river.It was easier to dock ships there,so it made sense that the settlers would choose that spot.However,objects found nearby suggested the fort was located further away.The new spot probably gave the settlers more protectio from enemy ships.                                                                                                                                                

The first objects were found in 1861.Archeologist,the name for scientist who study objects from the past ,uncovered armor and weapons.They also discovered the floors of buildings.Over 100 years later, a group effort to find the exact spot where the fort was built began.                                                                                                                                              

 

The National Park Service led a five year study of the area to figure out how the land was used. They knew that this would help then decide where to look for proof of the fort.The people doing the study used computer mapping software to make an image of the area.            

 

 

 

Thats when they finally found James Fort!The first thing they found was a set of marks on the ground.The marks showed where the forts walls used to be.Between all the stories they heard and read,and drawings they made,the archeologists knew that the fort would be shaped like a triangle.They  made maps and found out that the fort stretched all the way to the river.The ledges were designed to hold canons.The archeologists also found eleven cellars,dozens of burial sites ,and 10 buildings all within the border of the fort.                                                     

 

 

Today,the group finds nearly 1 million objects each year.The objects include pottery,tools,coins,and even metal toys for children.In the 1600s,people used to throw their trash down n unused well or into a big pit.While digging in the area,the archaeologists found the trash the settlers threw away,including the bones of animals they ate.The imformation learned from these objects helps us understand how the people in James Fort lived.We now know how the settlers fought the Powhatan tribe that often attacked them.We also know what the settler did to survive the difficult years when they had little food.                                          

 

 

  It is exciting to discover objects that were regularly used by people who lived hundreds of years ago.It gives us a piece of our past and ties us to people who fist started the American colonies.                                                                                                                                          

 

 

Most of what we know about George Washington comes from his time as a soldier and president.Biographies dont have very much imformation about hs childhood.Thats changing,however.Recent discoveries at Washingtons childhood home had helped historians know more about Goerge Washington as a boy.                                                                            

 

 

People have lived on the land known as Ferry Farm for over 12,000 years.Its location makes it a perfect place to build a home.There for,its not surprising that George Washingtons father,Augustine Washington,moved his family there.Goerge Washington was just 6 years old at the time.                                                                                                                              

 

 

 

 

No one knew exactly where the Washington home was located since the actual building was long gone.Howevr,archeologists believed that the stone base under the house was still there.They started digging in 2003.It took over a year,but they finally found it.The first buildings they found were the kitchen,slave quarters,and storage houses.They found the main farmhouse a few yeats later.                                                                                                            

 

At least four other houses have been built on the Ferry Farm land,so the diggers needed to find proof that this was George Washingtons farmhouse.Records show that the Washingtons had a fire in their house.The diggers found pieces of burnt pottery.The suggests a fire occurred there.They also found part of a clay pipe.We know that Washington smoked clay pipes,so this discovery gives more proof it is the right house.       

 

The process of digging at the Ferry Farm is a careful one.Each year,many teams will work on the site.The can be up to 35 people on a team!The first team maps the area using 3d computers that can track what is underground.The imformation is recorded so that the people will know what it looked like before people started digging.Another team focuses on the actual digging,and the place the team does the digging is called a dig.Those archeologists start their dig with what are called skim shovels.These shovels are so small,flat,and sharp that they can remove thin layers of soil,one at a time.That soil is then placed in a box with a half inch screen at the bottom.This lets the dirt fall out while the artifacts stay in.The diggers also use a process called troweling.Troweling is when archeologists use small shovels,paint brushes,and wooden picks to remove dirt.It can take up to two weeks to dig a 25-square-foot section!Another team spends days in the lab studying the objects that are found.The whole process is slow and tiresome,but its worth it.

 

 

 

The discovery of Washingtons home is important for many reasons.First,it give the citizens of the United States a better understanding of who George Washington was before he became famouse.We also begin to know why he made the decisions he did.Another thing it does is help historians learn the type of life Colonial Americans lived.All of these things are key parts of our past as Americans.                                                                            

 

Ferry Farm offers many opportunities for kids to get involved.The George Washington society runs summer workshops with both clasroom and outdoor activities.Kids can explore the site,experience colonial life,and become junior archeologists.Kids can sign up for classes,games,and crafts.The is even an interactive website!It challenges kids to solve puzzles about the work being done at the Ferry Farm.                                                               

 

Digging around in the dirt can give you more than just dusty jeans.The folks at Ferry Farm are bringing to life the countrys first president in ways we have never seen.

The job of an archeologist is about digging up some lost artifacts.

One unique find of an archeologist is Fort James.

Long ago, in 1994, a group of people were interested in long lost artifacts, buildings, among many others. This "studying of the past" began the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The project was designed to discover the secrets of Fort James in Jamestown, Virginia (one of the thirteen colonies). For over 200 years, people thought that Fort James had been washed away by a torrent. Some say that it might be around if archeologist discovered the area. Now, about a hundred years later, a group of archeologists teamed up to find the long lost artifacts of the now-old-and-historical Fort James. To help find the area of the fort, they rely on the National Park Service (which led a five-year-study of the area). The group of archeologists knew this would help them decide where to look for definite proof.

When they reached Fort James, the first thing they saw where footprints on the ground. These marks showed where the fort's location used to be. But, that's the first thing they found, because today the group of archeologists had found one million of these artifacts now to be shown at a museum. These include pottery, tools, coins, and metal tools.

One other unique find is the long lost tale of George Washington, his home, and the many artifacts that he had.

A group of archeologists (different from the ones that discovered Fort James) teamed up to "dig up" George Washington's past. The archeologists made a trip to Ferry Farm to CAREFULLY dig up the artifacts George Washington had when he was six. First, information is collected before the dig. Meanwhile, another team of archeologists focused on the dig of Washington's past.  This team started with small, flat, and sharp shovels called skim shovels. These shovels can only remove thin layers of soil, one at a time. Then, it's placed in a box with a half-inch screen at the bottom, which lets dirt fall out while artifacts stay in. Archeologists also use troweling, another digging process. Troweling is when archeologists use wooden picks, small shovels, and paint brushes. Meanwhile, another team studies the artifacts. The dig is tiresome and torturous, but it's definitely worth the dig.

Kids can also get involved with being an archeologist. In example, Ferry Farm can offer many kids to get involved, so they open the George Washington society, which runs summer workshops with both classroom and outdoor activites. Kids can explore the site, learn about the life of a colonist, and become junior archeologists. Kids can also visit an interactive website.

How to become an archeologist is simple. You just start with a pick or a skim shovel, scoop up the earth with a dustpan, then scrape off dirt with a knife, carry it away with a wheelbarrow, and then the troweling starts. It may not be a clean and short job, but it's worth the try. Just keep digging until you will find the long lost artifacts of a historical person!

Archeologist's Life

                                                                        By Jacob Sagum  

    Archeologist have a lot of jobs to do, I will tell what they do to find artifacts. To find artifacts in an area, the archeologist will need many teams, each team needs at least 35 archeologist. Each team will have their own part in their area. Each person will also use a set of tools. Let's take a look at the first team of archeologist.

 

    The first team uses 3D computers to map out the area and track whats underground. Information has to be recorded for people to know how it looked before they started to dig in the area. That is what the first team will do to search for artifacts.

 

    Another team comes in to work on digging.The team will dig in an area called a dig.Archeologist use small, flat and sharp shovels used to dig thin layers of soil called skim shovels. The soil is put into a box with a half inch screen at the bottom for the dirt to fall out and also use a technique called troweling, which is when they use mini shovels, paint brushes, and picks made out of wood to get dirt of the artifacts. Then the third and final team will work on the rest.

 

    The next team will soon take the artifacts to the lab. They will be taken to the lab to be studied and researched on. It will take days to study the artifacts. They also use different computers to research on the artifact. They will also tell what time period the artifact is from is due to what the artifact could be used for. This is was what the third team will do with the artifacts.

 

    There are many reasons why it's important to find artifacts.One reason why it is important to find artifacts to have proof of what happened in history. Another reason why is it tells us more about other famous people in history. One last reason is it could also tell more about other time periods. Those were a few reasons why archeologist search for artifacts.

 

    Here are a few tools archeologist use that people commonly know. One tool is the trowel, the most known tool which is used to cut and scrape different layers of dirt or soil. Another tool is the skim shovel, its used to carefully remove thin layers of dirt. Other tools are the pick and shovel, they are mostly the first tool used in a dig. These were the most known tools used by archeologist.

 

    These tools are also used by archeologist, but are not known by most people. The first tool is the knife, which is used to scrape the dirt off of artifacts. A few other tools are the whisk and dustpan, it is used for to brush dirt away from the evacuation site. The last tool is the wheelbarrow, it can be used to carry dirt to certain areas. These were a few of the tools used by archeologist.

Archeologists dig up as many things as they can. If they don't find anything the first day, they'll continue the next day either in a new spot, or a little farther away from the old spot they started on.

 

     There are several different teams to dig up these artifacts. The first team maps the area using 3D computers so they can track what is underground before they dig, so they know what they are digging for. another team focuses on the actual digging. Those archeologists start their dig with what are called skin shovels. These shovels are meant to remove thin layers of dirt at once. Then, the dirt is placed in a box with a screen at the bottom so the dirt falls and the artifacts stay in the box. The archeologists then use paint brushes and pick to remove all the dirt from the artifact. Another team spends days and days studying what these artifacts are, what they mean, and what they are used for.

They use picks and shovels to dig into the rocks or soil. The whisk and the dustpan are used to brush dirt off of the artifacts. They also use the knife to carefully scrape off the dirt around the artifacts. The wheelbarrow is used to transport items from one place to another. A skim shovel is used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop. The trowel is probably the most popular tool in archeology. It is used to scrape and cut soil to view different layers.

 

     Do you know what archeologists usually look for? They usually look for ancient artifacts from the past. Dig dig... pat pat... heave heave... sweat sweat. Archeologists have a difficult, but rewarding job in

which they find ancient artifacts. They use many different tools, and use them to find different things. They have to go through different steps in order to find what they are searching for. These are the ways archeologists dig up history.

 

Archeologists first map the ground where they will dig. They use 3D computers to track things in the

ground. The image that comes out is the map of the area. They then record all that information, so the diggers know what it is like in that area. The mappers have an easier job than the diggers, though.

 


The archeologists that dig do it in the place called the dig. They use tools such as a knife, pick, shovel,

trowel, skim shovel, whisk, dustpan, and wheelbarrow. The tools are each used for different reasons. The diggers first start digging with their skim shovels, which remove thin layers of soil at a time. The dirt scooped is put in a box with a small screen at the bottom, letting dirt fall, but keeping artifacts in. Archeologists also use their trowels in a process called troweling. That is when they use small shovels, picks, and brushes to take away soil and dirt. The digging part of archeology is undoubtedly the hardest.

 

The final step in archeology is studying them. Another team of archeologists spend days studying the

artifacts found. The people who study the artifacts find information about the past. They can find out how people lived, or use the artifacts to find a specific place. Studying the objects is probably fun, since you can find information about history.

 

As you see, archeology is a hard job that many people rely on to find historic things. The artifacts

archeologists find are useful in finding information about history. Without archeology, what would we know about history?
