Digging Up the Past: Archeologists

                                                                                         Lauren Vuong

 

           Have you ever wondered what an archeologist does? Archeologists are people who "dig up the past". There are many archeologists all over the world, and they all do different things. For example, some dig up fossils of dinosaurs to discover about when they lived and etc. while others study artifacts that date back to 1300 B.C. The phrase "digging up the past" was made because archeologists had been digging for facts about the past through artifacts and other. Many of the pottery pieces, statues, and pieces of statues in museums came from the work of archeologists across the globe. Archeologist's jobs are to find clues about the past.

 

 

           Now a days, some of the tools used by the archeologists are picks, shovels, whisks, dustpans, knives, wheelbarrows, skim shovels, and trowels. Even though we are in the 21 century, they still use these basic tools. Along with this, current day archeologists use 3 dimensional computers to scan the ground for remains and they use other technology too. We are lucky to have modern day technology to help us in many things. Archeologists can take less time, energy, and money using these tools because then they don't dig up the wrong areas. Some of the tools archeologists use have special jobs. For example, a pick and a shovel: used to dig into the earth, can cart away dirt. A whisk and dustpan can be used to: brush away dirt and uncover artifacts/ clear away dirt from search site. Knives are useful to do careful digging around artifacts and to scrape dirt away. A skim shovel is useful because you can take thin layers of dirt off. One of the more common tools throughout the world is the trowel: used to scrape and cut into the soil. There are many tools, modern and classic, used in the study of archeology.

 

 

           Throughout the years, archeologists have discovered many interesting things. For instance, some archeologists are currently on a search for an ancient Mongolian king's, Ganges Kan, tomb. Others searched for George Washington's house. All studies took at least 2 years. It takes a lot of hard work and dedication to be an archeologist. Years if work may result to nothing. Many, though, believe it is a good job because you get discover the past. One article I read was called Finding Fort James. Fort James was part of the Revolutionary War and settlement of America. Early settlers lived there so after 200 years, in which people believed it was washed away by the river, the National Park Service asked some archeologists to go looking for traces of Fort James. It took 5 years, but finally they found the triangular structure stretching from the river, back into the mainland property. Many other searches have been issued to find facts about people of the past, how they lived, and etc.

 

 

            Overall, many studies have taken place throughout the years to find facts about the past and there have been many archeologists. I think that being an archeologist would be fun, but not my dream. it's just not me. Through and through, archeology is a hard job.

In my opinion, the main job of an archeologist would be to dig and find the valuables of famous people and places that know one knows anything about. In 1607, when settlers came from England to start a new life, most believed that James Fort was built near the river. The first objects were found in 1861 by scientists who study objects form the past.

 

             Also, archeologists tried to dig up George Washington's past. Since no one knew exactly where the Washington home was located since the actual building was long ago, the archeologists decided to try find the house. They started digging for the Washington house in 2003. Though it took over a year, they finally managed to find it. The first buildings found were the kitchen, slave quarters, and storage houses. They actually fond the main house a few years later. 

 

              Finally, the tools that they used were a pick and shovel that start the digging and close to the artifacts. Secondly, archeologists also use a knife which is used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts. To continue, these scientists use tool called a trowel which is the most common tool for a acrheologist to use. They are used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil. Fourth, archeologists use a wheelbarow to move items form one place to the next or to carry dirt away from the area. Fifth, they use a skim shovel to remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop. Finally, archeolgists use a whisk and a dustpan to brush off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site.

 

 

        These are the tools that most archeologists mainly use to dig an find the valuables of fomous people and places that know one knowa anythein about.

The Life of an Archeologist

                                                             By Jozef Platt

 

 

 

 

     The life of an archeologist is dirty, sometimes it can be even gross. Archeologist have an important job in life becaues they need to find out things about people. A lot of the time it's famous people. They need to figure out what certain people did in their life and thier childhood. It's very interesting.

 

    Archeologist have to use special tools because they don't want to damage anything. One of the tools they use are pick and shovel. This is use for to dig in the earth, close to the artifacts. Another one is the whisk and dustpan. This is used for to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site. Next is the knife. The knife is used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts. They use this thing called the wheelbarrow. This is used for to move iteams from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the excavation site. The skim shovel is used for to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop. Last, but certainly no least the trowel. The trowel is probably used to most often. Used t scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.

 

      Now who wants to be an archeologist!

Archeologists and their Work

 

     Have you ever wondered what an archeologist does for their job? Well, hopefully this report should answer all of your mind boggling questions that you have been dying to have answered.

 

     First off, an archeologist's job is to pretty much uncover history. And, as you probably know, digging up the past is a long, laborious process. They pick different sites such as Mr. George Washington's own childhood home! Wouldn't it be interesting to learn all about his childhood since we really don't know that much about it? Archeologists pick other interesting sites as well. If you could think of one famous person who would you pick?

 

     Archeologists have fancy, technical, modern day tools that play a big part in discovering our American history. A few example of tools and how they are used are:

 


The pick and shovel. The pick and shovel usually start the digging process. Their job is to slice and cut and dig into the earth to get close enough to the artifacts.
The whisk and dustpan. The whisk is used to simply brush off dirt and unwanted rubbish off the artifact and the dustpan is used to clear the dirt away. Just like a good spring cleaning!
Knife. A knife is used for precise and sharp digging. Also to scrape dirt off of the artifact.
The wheelbarrow. The wheelbarrow is practically used for the same purposes of yard work. It is used to clear dirt away or to transport items to another area.
The Skim Shovel. The skim shovel removes one layer of dirt at a time using a flat, sharp edge.

  6.The trowel. The trowel is used to dig, scrape, and cut to see different layers of dirt.

 

Now that you have viewed the different tools and their purposes, you can probably guess how long and frustrating at times the archeologist's job is!

 

     The sites the archeologists when to recently are Fort James and George Washington's old house. Some of the tools they probably used in the dig at Fort James are the wheelbarrow and knife and probably whisk and dustpan. The tools they probably used at George Washington's old home was probably the wheelbarrow the pick and shovel and the skim shovel.

 

     As you can see, the archeologist has a very long job that could take hours upon hours of their time. But they have a very important job no less and without them, we wouldn't know half of our history.

The jobs of an Archeologist

 

               The main job of an archeologist is toofind old stuff which are called artifacts. Artifacts are old things such as temples,fossils,etc.

              The first artifacts were found in 1861.Archeologists uncovered armor and weopons.THey also diascovered  floors.Over 100 years a group effort to find the spot wherethe fort was build. The national park service actually found it.

In 1994, a group of people interested in studying the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archeological Project. For over 200 years, people thought that the fort had been washed away by a river. The fort was built in 1607 when settlers came from England to start a new life. The first objects were found in 1861. Over 100 years later, a group effort to find the exact spot where the fort was built began. The National Park Service led a five-year study of the area to figure out how the land was used. The people doing the study used computer mapping software to make an image of the area. That's when they finally found James Fort. The archeologists found eleven cellars, dozens of burial sites, and ten buildings all within the border of the fort. Today, the group finds nearly 1 million objects each year. The objects include pottery, tools, coins, and even metal toys for children. In the 1600s, people used to throw their trash down an unused well or into a big pit. It is exciting to discover objects that were regularly used by people whou lived hundreds of years ago.

   Archeologists are people that study objects from the past. In 1994 a bunch of people interested in the past created the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. This project was made to find old secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown,Virginia. For Over 200 years, some people thought the James Fort was washed away by a river. Some discoveries in the area hinted that it might be still there in Jamestown,Virginia. The James Fort was built in 1607 when new people came to the 13 colonies to start a new life. Many people thought that the James Fort was built near a river. It was built there so it will we easier to dock their ships there so it made sense that the people would chose that spot to dock. The objects found nearby suggested to move the fort to move farther. The new spot that the settlers found was more protected from enemy ships.In conclusion 1994 was when the start of the James Town Rediscovery Archaeological Project.

 

  

 

  In 1861 archeologists found the first objects. Archeologists discover armor and weapons and they also discover the floor of the James Fort. Over 100 years later people tried to find the location of the James Fort again. The National Park Service led a five year study of the area to try to find how the land was used. They new that that it would help to find the location of the James Fort. The people doing the studying used a computer mapping software to imagine how the area would look like.They finally found the location they found marks on the ground the marks where the fort's wall.The archeologists thought the shape of the fort was a triangle but it was really stretched all away a crossed the river.  In conclusion found objects that lead them to find the location of the fort.

 

 

   Another thing that archeologists study was George Washington. People have lived on the land called Ferry Farm for over 12,000 .It makes a perfect location to built a a house. That's why it is not surprising that George Washington's father moved his family there.When his dad moved him to Ferry Farm George was only 6 years old!No one really knew were was his home located since the actual building was no longer there. However archeologists believed that the stone base under the house was still there. The archeologists started to dig in 2003.It took them over a year, but they finally found the stone base.The first thing the archeologists found was the kitchen,slave quarters, and the storage houses.After a few years later they found a farmhouse.In conclusion George Washington lived in Ferry Farm

 

 

   At last the four houses have been built on Ferry Farm land, so the diggers needed to find proof why this was George Washington farmland.Records show that Washington had a fire in their house. The diggers found pieces of burnt pottery. This suggests a fire occurred in his house.They also found a part of clay pipe. We know that Washington smoked clay pipes, so this gave more proof this was George Washington's house.In conclusion the archeologists found 4 houses and they think one of them is Washingtonians

     One example of them in action is when a group archeologist went to find information on George Washington's past. Archaeologists

Have you heard of Archaeologists? Maybe you've heard of people that dig up dinosaur bones?

Those people are archaeologists. Many Archaeologists dig up old artifacts or small pieces of things hundreds, and maybe thousands of years old. There are archeologists all over the world. There are archeologists in China, Canada, Australia, Russia, Kenya, France, and here in the U.S.A. There are archeologists many other places, too.

Tools they use are pickaxes, shovels, whisks, dustpans, knives, wheelbarrows, skim shovels,

and trowels. Everything is used for something different. I bet you were wondering what a trowel was, or the difference between a skim shovel and a regular shovel. Well, I'm about to tell you.

Pick and shovel

Pickaxes and shovels are used to break and dig up dirt near the spot where the artifacts are.

Most digs start with these two tools. Picks are used to break up dirt and make the easier for the shovel. Shovels are used to dig dirt up to make the artifacts easier to get to.

Whisk and dustpan

These tools are used to brush dirt off of artifacts. They can also be used to brush dirt away very

close to the artifact, so the archaeologist won't damage the artifact.

Knife

Knives are used to scrape dirt away from the edge of the artifact. They can be used  to scrape

dirt from the insides of artifacts.

Wheelbarrow

Wheelbarrows are used to haul dirt away from the dig site. They can also carry heavy artifacts

away from the dig site.

Skim Shovel

This tool is used to dig layer by layer of soil from the dig site, and is mostly used when close

to the artifact.

Trowel

The most common tool used. It is used to scrape away dirt to examine the layers of soil.

 

Now I hope you know more about archaeology and how it's done. Thank you for reading my

report about archeologists.

Archeologist have an interesting, hard working job. They are counted on by many people. Would you want to be an archeologist? I am going to tell you about the job of an archeologist! The tools they use, where they discover the past, and digging!

 

 

                     I have you heard about those people that are discovering new things? They are archeologist! Archeologist use many tools to find interesting things. Some of the tools they use are a Pick and Shovel, Whisk and Dustpan, Knife, Wheelbarrow, Skim Shovel, and Trowel. The pick and shovel are used to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts. Now those two are really needed! The whisk and dustpan are used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site. Boy, those are two  things you will miss if you forgot them at home! Careful digging and scrapping dirt from around the artifacts is easier if you have a knife. Moving items from one place to another isn't easy without a wheelbarrow! Wheelbarrows are also used to carry dirt away from the excavation site. A skim shovel is used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop. The TROWEL is the most common tool in archeology. It is used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil. If this one is not in your back pocket, you probably won't be finding anything!

 

 

                       For archeologist to find things they have to find the spot first.

Finding the spot isn't easy, you have to search and search and search.  Another thing that you have to do is to calculate where (for example) George Washington lived and where he would go, etc.  You would have to figure all that out then go there and find it.

  It doesn't sound so easy, but it is quite enjoyable!

The digging leads you to the end and the suprise is waiting there!  Also you have a team of up to 35 people so that makes it a lot better! The first team maps the area using 3D computers that can track what is underground. The information is recorded so that people will know what it looked like before people started digging. Another team focuses on the actual digging, and the place the team does the digging is called a dig. Skim Shovels are used for when you dig. The whole digging process is slow and tiresome, but it's worth it.

You have to work hard and get dirty but that's where all the fun comes from! The past is always fun to find in the present to show the future! So you should try archeology as your job in the future, I might even consider it!

Have you ever wondered how scientists and historians know what happened in the past? Those scientists are called archeologists and they study objects from a long time ago. They collect the data, find the artifacts, and use different tools to do it.

    

      Archeologists need a place to start so they can conduct the investigation. That's where the data comes in. They use other scientist's research to know where to find what they are looking for. After they know where to look, they have to create data of their own to help other scientists. If they want to figure something out they have to find the problem and use their knowledge to research it. Collecting data is a giant part of how they discover information.

     

        After collecting all their data, scientists can look for the artifacts. This is important because actually seeing the objects makes it easier to study them. Archeologists look for artifacts where they know they can find them. But why do they look in the first place? This question is very easy to answer. Archeologists look for artifacts to find out more about the lives of people who lived before us and to advance in areas where other people needed help. Scientists also look for artifacts to find how things came to be. Documents are artifacts that we couldn't do without. If we did not have a documentation of how things happened it would be much harder to study the way things worked. Artifacts play an extremely important role in the study of history.

 

         How do scientists get these things like data and artifacts? They use tools of course! Not just any tools though. They use specific tools to do specific jobs. Some of these tools are shovels and picks which help the scientists clear out land that they need to move in order to find their artifacts. No scientist could get this job done if they did not have the right tools to do it. Archeologists use whisks to wipe the dirt off of their artifacts and to collect small samples of their discoveries. They can even use knives to do things like scraping dirt off of important objects. These are only a few things that archeologists use for their investigations. Tools are another example of something very important to discovering information.

 

         Scientists and historians know what happened in the past for all of these reasons and some more. Archeologists certainly have to collect their data, find their artifacts, and last but not least, use all kinds of special tools.

Archeologists

    Archeologists have really cool jobs. they get to learn about things from the past. They get to find artifacts, fossils, and other neat things. Archeologists learn new things every day and can discover old artifacts from long ago.

     The first thing archeologists do is get all the supplies they need. The supplies that they need include, a pick and shovel, a whisk and dustpan, a knife, a wheelbarrow, a skim shovel, and a trowel. A pick and a shovel is used for digging in the earth, a whisk and dustpan is used for brushing dirt off artifacts, a knife is used for scraping dirt from around artifacts, a wheelbarrow is used to move items from one place to another, a skim shovel is used for removing a thin layer of soil in each scoop, and a trowel is used for scraping and cutting to view the different layers of soil.                                                         Next, archeologists need to find a place to work. They would need a place with a lot of artifacts or somewhere that had a village or house that isn't there anymore. Somewhere like Fort James, Virginia would work. Fort James was built in 1607 so there is lots of artifacts there. Places like this would be perfect for archeologists to dig.

    Then, archeologists would start digging for artifacts. They look for parts of houses, floors of buildings, armor or weapons, cellars, or anything old. They would use a trowel, a skim shovel, and a pick and shovel to dig. Then the archeologists bring the items they find to a certain spot in a wheelbarrow.

     Last, the archeologists get the whisk and dustpan, knife, and start to clean up the artifacts they found. once they do that they start studying them and find the history of  what they found.

      As you can see, being an archeologist is an exciting job and one day you might decide to be one too!

The process of digging in places is a careful one.Each year many teams will work on a famous place.The way the archeologists dig up these atifacts is with having  groups work on different things like let's say the first group maps the area using 3D computers that can track what is underground.The information is recorded so that people will know what it looked like before people started digging.Another team focuses on the actual digging, and the place the team does the digging is called a dig. Those archeologists start their dig with what are called skim shovels. These shovels are so small,flat and sharp that they can remove nothing but thin layers of soil,one at a time. Trowling is when archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove dirt. It can take up to two weeks to dig a place that is 25-square-foot section! In 1994, a group of people interested in studying the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The project was designed to discover the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia. For over 200 years, people thought that fort had been washed away by a river. Some discoveries in the area hinted that it might still be around.

 

 

  The fort was built in 1607 when settlers came from England to start a new life. Most believed that James Fort was built near a river. It was easier to dock ships there, so it made sense that the settlers would choose that spot.

However, objects found nearby suggested the fort was located further away. The new spot probably gave the settlers more protectionfrom enemy ships.

 

 

   The first objects were found in 1861. Archeologists,the name for scientists who study objects from the past,

uncovered armor and weapons. They also discovered the floors of buildings. Over 100 years later, a group effort to find the exact spot where the fort was built began.

 

 

  The National Park Service led a five-year study of the area to figure out how the land was used. They knew that this would help them decidewhere to look for proof of the fort. The people doing the study used computer mapping software to make an image of the area.

 

 

   That's when they finally found James Fort! The first thing they found was a set of marks on the ground. The marks showed where fort's walls used to be. Between all stories they heard and read, and drawings they made, the archeologists knew that the fort would be shaped like a triangle. They made maps and found out that the fort streched all the way to the river. Then they realized there were stone ledges built over the river. The ledges were designed to hold canons. The archeologists also found eleven cellers, dozens of burial sites, and ten buildings all within the border of the fort.

       Next, is about the different tools that they use. The different tools that an Archeologists use are a pick and shovel, a whisk and dustpan, a knife, a wheelbarrow, a skim and shovel and a trowel. All these tools have a very special meaning and are used for different things. A pick and shovel are the two tools that most people in a dig start with. they are used to dig into the earth, that are close to the artifacts. A whisk and a dustpan are used to brush the dirt off the artifacts and clear away the dirt form the excavation site. A knife is used for carefully digging out the artifacts and to scrape the dirt away from around the artifacts. Skim shovels are a shovel with a flat edge used top carefully remove a thin layer of soil at a time with each scoop. The last tool is a trowel. A trowel is probably the most common tool in archeology and is used to scrape and cut to veiw the different layers of soil.

A group of people who are interested in the past got together and started Jamestown Rediscovery. The project was put together to find James Fort secrets in Virginia. Over 200 years, people thought the fort has been washed away by a river. The fort was built in 1607 when settlers came to the land from England to start a new life.

 

 

   A lot of people believed that the fort was built by a river. It was easier to dock ships there so it makes more sense. Objects were found nearby and people suggested the fort was farther away. The new spot gave settlers more protection in case an enemy is nearby.

 

 

    Objects were found in 1861. Archeologists uncovered armor and weapons. And floors of buildings were found. More than 100 years later a group went searching in the exact same spot where the fort was built. 

 

 

    National Parks gave a 5-year study of how the land was used and looked for proof of the fort. They finally found it! The first thing they found was a set of marks on the ground. The marks led where the fort wall used to be. And today the group finds nearly 1 million objects a year. Including pottery, coins, tools, and metal toys!

                                                   By: Andre

 

     Archeologist, also known as scientist have a big job. Their job is to discover things from the past, such as George Washington's home or the James Fort. This is a very exciting job because one you have found a peice of history, it belongs to you.

 

          When working you have to be very careful because you may find a piece of evidence that doesn't belong in that certain category. Then you'll have to go back and find it, but by then another archeologist would've already been observing it.

 

      Taking your time is another important rule for archeologist. If they are rushing the could break the object, lose the object, or hurt themselves. If any of those things happened they would be upset.

 

      Being an archeologist isn't an easy job, it takes practice to get profection.

History is very importaint to us. It helps us understand how we lived in the past.

 

Objects help us tell about the past. Even an object found in a old house can tell a story about a person, place, or thing.

 

In George Washingtons house, the diggers found a clay pipe and burnt pottery indicating it was his house.

 

There are teams of up to 35 people that dig up these relics. They are called archeologists. They dig the relics up carfully so they dont destroy or disturb the artifacts.

 

The archeologists use skim shovels to remove layers of dirt from the dig site. Then they put the dirt in a box with a screen at the bottom that lets dirt fall but not the artifacts.

 

Another way to dig is called troweling. Troweling is when you use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to dig up dirt.

 

It takes about two weeks to dig up a 25-sqare-foot section when you use troweling to dig. Its a long time but its worth it!

THE PICK AND THE SHOVEL

FROM THE PAST .

 

THE WHISK AND THE DUSTPAN

 

THE WHISK AND THE DUSTPAN  HELP US BRUSH DIRT OFF THE ARTIFACTS                 AND ?CLEAR AWAY DRIT FROM THE                                                                                     EXCAVATION  SITE.                                                                                                                                                                                  
  KNIFE

TORWEL

A group of people interested in studding the past are archeologists.They work hard and research the past of very historic people like George Washington.Archeologists that looked for George Washington and the Fort James past are pretty famous now.Archeologists had to discover the secrets of the James Fort in Jamestown,Virginia.For over 200 years, people thought that the fort had been washed away by a river.Some discoveries in the area hinted that it might still be around.It was easier to dock there, so it made sense that the settlers would choose that spot.However, objects found nearby suggested the fort was located further away.The new spot probably gave the settlers more protection from enemy ships.The fist objects were found in 1861.Archeologists uncovered weapons and armor.It gives us piece of our past.                                 

       

           Most of what we know about George Washington comes from his time as a soldier and president.Archeologists don't have very much information about his childhood.Recent discoveries at Washington's childhood home have helped historians know a little more.Therefore, its not surprising that George Washington's father,Augustine Washington, moved his family to Ferry Farm, a perfect place to build a home.George was just six years old at that time.No one knew exactly where the Washington home was located since the actual building was long gone.However, archeologists believed that the stone base under the house was still there.They started digging in 2003.The first buildings under ground they found were the kitchen, slave quarters, and storage houses.they found the main farmhouse a few years later.This discovery gives more proof it is the right house.

To find the information they use 3D computers to track what is underground. The information is recorded so that other people can start digging. They start skim shovels which are flat shovels. Wow! Archeolegists are really cool! For poeple that are not aware, Archeologists are people that study ancient artifacts. They have a vast range of tools, computers, and radar that help them find the artifacts. Some tools are the Pick and Shovel, which most of the digs start with. They are used to dig into the site and find artifacts. Archeologists also use the Whisk and Dustpan, which are used to brush dirt off of artifacts and clear dirt from the dig site. Following, there is the knife, and that is used for causuos digging andmoving dirt from the artifact. Next, we have the Whellbarrow, which is used to move either dirt or items from the dig site, and the Skim Shovel, used to scrape a thin layer of earth from the dig. Finally, there's the Trowel, which is most likely the most common tool for Archeolologists, used to cut and scrape to look at different parts of the soil.

Archeologists

 Archeologists are people who have the job to study objects from the past. They go to abandoned historical sights to dig up artifacts. Which are objects from the past.

   A group in 1994 were interested in studying the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. They were going to find and study Fort James. They were going to dig up old objects to study what people used in the old days. It took over 100 years to find the exact spot were Fort James was! The National Park Service led a study of the area to figure out how the land was used. This would help them decide where to look for proof of the fort. That's when they finally found the fort! They found a set of marks on the ground indicating where the fort's wall was. The archeologists knew the fort was a shape of a triangle from all the stories they have heard.

   Today the group finds nearly 1 million objects each year. The objects include pottery, tools, coins, and even little toys for the children. They found trash the settlers threw away in a well or large pit. Including the bones of animals they ate. Archeology gives us a piece of our past and ties us to the people who lived hundreds of years ago.

   Archeologists are important because if we didn't have them we would know very little about our past. Also about what life was like in the old days.

Archeologists are scientists that study our past. They study our past by digging up artifacts. The artifacts are useful because the archeologists use them to tell about the past.

  

          One group of archeologists were determined to find Fort James. While looking for the fort they found many interesting artifacts about how the people lived. By using computer software they were able to see the most accurate place of where Fort James was. Some artifacts that the archeologists found around the fort were coins, metal toys for children, and weapons.

 

            Another group of archeologists wanted to uncover George Washington's past at Ferry Farm. At first the team found the slave quarters, kitchen, and the storage houses. Then they found the main farmhouse.

 

               The tools and processes that the archeologists use are complicated. Archeologists use picks and shovels to dig into ground near artifacts. A whisk is used to brush off dirt from artifacts. Knifes are used for careful digging. Wheelbarrows carry heavy things. A skim shovel is used to remove a thin layer of soil. Trowels are used to scrape and cut to view the differing layers of soil.

The Pick and the Shovel it for to dig into the earth close to the artifact.

The Whisk and Dustpan is used to brush dirt off the artifact and clear away dirt from the excavation site.

The Knife is used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts.

The WheelBarrow is used to move items from one place to another or carry dirt away from the excavation site.

The Skim shovel is used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop.

The Trowel is used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.

The job of an archeologist is a hard one, but very rewarding. This paper will gude you through the job of an archeologist. Now lets get digging!

 

Archeologists usually work in very dusty enviornments where there is a very large chance of finding ancient artifacts, such as toys, tools, inventions, and even entire buildings or cities! The artifacts they find are their pay, so the more items found, the more money. But it is very hard to find these objects, and most archeologists are lucky to find one every week! The items are also used for reasearch on past cultures. For example, if a goblet was found in Greece, it would most likely be sent to greek mythology professors for research.

 

The tools of an archeologist are very simple.You have the pick and shovel, but did you know there are more than six others? The shovel is, obviously the most common tool found with archeologists. The pick is used where the shovel cannot pierce the ground. It is very heavy, and has two very sharp ends used for cracking rock. Then there is the whisk and dustpan. They may not be very big, but they are essential tools to archeologists. The whisk is used to clear dust from delicate objects, such as teacups or very old books.The duspan is used to gather up the dirt and see if it has special minerals inside. Now we come to the knife, another essential, but small, tool. The knife is used for getting most of the dirt off of artifacts so that the whisk can get the remainder, because a whisk is only a brush and can't get all of that dirt off. I could go on and on about the tools, because there are many out there, but I digress.

 

So, as you can see, the life of an archeologist is a very confusing and long one, but in most cases, a fun and challenging one.

Who are Archeologists?

      Archeologists are very interesting and important people. You might have some questions though such as, "Who are archeologists?" or "What do they do?" Well, archeologists are people who study artifacts or objects from the past or dig up mysterious or well known artifacts from the past. They are important because, they help us discover past artifacts such as, James Fort or George Washington's clay pipes.

 

                                                                  Discovering James Fort

     James Fort was built in 1607 when settlers wanted to start a new life. In 1994, a group of archeologists studied the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological project. The project mission was to discover the secrets of the James Fort. But, beforethat, the first items were found in 1861. Archeologists found armor and weapons. Then, 100 years later, a group found the exact location where the fort began. The National Park Service studied for five years to discover how the land was used. They used computer mapping to make an image for that certain area. Then, they finally found James Fort! First, they found marking on the ground. The marks displayed where the fort's walls used to be. Then, they found stone ledges built over the river which, were designed to hold cannons. Also, archologists found 11 cellars, lots of burial sights, and 10 buildings! For archeoloists this was a fantastic discovery and a great acheivement that will be remembered by the forever!

 

                                                                                 Tools

  Archeologists use many different tools for all of their hard work. Most, if not all, of the tools were used for digging as you can probably imagine. One of the tools they use is a shovel. A shovel is used to dig up the dirt. Another one of the tools they use is a pick or pickaxe. A pickaxe's job is very similar to a shovel even, though they look different. A pickaxe is used to dig into the Earth. Unlike, the shovel it is used to dig stone and harder subtances than the shovel. Now, let's talk about the whisk and the dustpan. You probably used these before in your homes. A whisk is used to sweep up dirt into the dustpan. You can probably picturing yourself using this tool at home. Now, lets move on to the knife. Another tool you probably use in your everyday life. But, for archeologists it is used differently. A knife is used for carefully used for digging and to scrape dirt from the artifacts. There are more tools but, those are some main ones

 

 

               Anyway, that's all I have to share. Archeologists are very interesting people and will never be forgotten and are important in history.

How much do you know about archeologists? Do you know the tools they use? What about different historical facts they've discovered? Soon you will be an expert on all of these topics and more.

First you need to know the tools they used. These are some tools they use:


     
Pick and Shovel
Whisk and Dustpan
Knife
Wheelbarrow
Skim Shovel
Trowel

These are used for scraping away layers, digging shallow and deep digs, and transporting and clearing materials such as dirt. When archeologists search for hidden mysteries buried beneath the ground, they can't just jump right in, they have to check all their equipment and determine which tool is best for the work their doing. If they were looking for small delicate artifacts right beneath the surface they night use a knife or a skim shovel and then a whisk to dust treasures off. If they were looking for the base of a building buried deep in the ground, they would probably use a pick and shovel and then a wheelbarrow to wheel away dirt.

If it weren't for groups like The National Park Service or Ferry Farm we wouldn't know very much about America's history. Ferry Farm discovered George Washington's life before he became president. It took a year just to find the stone base of his house. The National Park Service conducted a five-year investigation of James Fort. It's hard to believe, but this group finds approximately 1 million artifacts each year! They've found tools, coins, metal toys for children, pottery, etc.

Now you know all about the job of an archeologist. Could you even imagine how much effort each person puts in each day. It's hard work being an archeologist!

In 1994 a group of people were interested in studying the past of Jamestown  and they called it the Rediscovery Archaeological Project. James Fort was built in 1607 and it was built next to a river so it was easier to dock for ships. In researches the fort was located somewhere else. The new spot was probably gave people protection from enemy ships.

 

The first objects were found in 1861. Archeologists study objects from the past,like uncovered armor and weapons.They also discover floors and buildings. Over 100 years later a group of people put an effort to find where the fort was first built.

 

The National Park Service led a 5-year study in the area to figure out what the land was really used for. They knew that this would help them decide where Fort James really was. the people used the computer to use a mapping software to make an image of the area.

 

That is when they finally found Fort James! the first thing they did was set marks on the ground. The marks would show where the corners of the fort wall where. from all the stories they read they new that the fort was shaped like a triangle. They made maps and they found out that the fort stretched all the way to the river. They soon realized that stone ledges were built for cannons and to hold cannons for enemies ships or troops.The archeologists also found dozens of burial sites and cellars and ten buildings within the border of the fort.

 

Today the group finds 1 million objects each year. Archeologists

 

 

       What is an archeologist? It's a person who carefully digs up artifacts. Archeologists have a very difficult job. They have to very carefully and gently clean and find artifacts. They have to have gentile hands when they work and a lot of patents. It may take them up to two weeks to dig a 25-square-foot section! That's along time!

        Archeologists can find many things. Some archeologist found the remains of Fort James in Jamestown, Virginia. Others found some things from George Washington's childhood, from his childhood home. Lots of things have been found by archeologists. Lots more are waiting to be found.

                The place where archeologists do the digging, is called a dig. Archeologists have many tools:

 


Pick and Shovel- Lots of digs start with these tools. They are used to dig into the earth, to get closer to the artifacts.
Whisk and Dustpan- This is used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away the dirt from the excavation site.
Knife- This tool is used for careful digging, and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts.
Wheelbarrow- these are used to move items from one place to another, or to carry dirt away from the excavation site.
Skim Shovel- A shovel with a flat edge. This is used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil with each scoop.
Trowel- This is probably the most common tool in archeology. It is used to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.

Archeologists have though jobs, long ones too. I think it might be cool to be an archeologist, but maybe not. It would be cool to find something. But I don't think I have the patents. I like reading about them. I hope you do too.

I am going to tell u about how archeologist dig up stuff from the past.the process of digging at the Ferry Farm is a careful one.Each year, many teams will work on the site. There can be up to 35 people on a team! The first team maps the area using 3D computers that can track what is underground. The information is recorded so that people will know what it looked like  before people stared digging. Another team focuses on the actual digging , and the  place the team does the digging is called a dig. Those archeologist  start their dig with what are called skim shovels. These are to small ,flat and sharp that they can remove thin layers of soil, at a time. That soil is than placed in a box  with a half-inch screen at the bottom. This lets  the dirt fall out while the artifacts stay in. The diggers also use a process called troweling is when archeologist use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove dirt. It can take up to two weeks to dig a 25-square-feet section! Another team spends days in the lab studying the objects that are found. The whole process is slow and tiresome, but it's worth it.

All of these things are key parts of our past as many lived Americans. Digging around in the dirt can give you more than just dusty jeans. The folks at Ferry Farm are bringing to life the country's first president in ways we have never seen.    

 

I'm going to tell you about getting involved Ferry Farm offers many opportunities for kids to get involved. The George Washington society runs summer workshops with both classrooms and outdoor activities.  Kids can explore the site, experience colonial life, and became junior archeologist. Kids can sign can sign up for classes, games, and crafts. There is even an interacitve website! It challenges kids to solve puzzles about the work being done at Ferry Farm.

Archeologists   

    What are archeologists? They are scientists that discover and study things from the past. Some tools they use to help them find the artifacts they need are: picks, shovels, whisks, dustpans, knives, wheelbarrows, skim shovels and trowels.Archeologists use these tools to find artifacts that help people understand the mysteries of the past.

Tools And How They Use Them

     Picks and shovels are basic tools that archeologists use to dig up dirt.

A whisk and dustpan brushes off dirt from the artifacts that the archeologists find.

Knives are used to scrape dirt from the edges of the artifacts.

Wheelbarrows are used to carry artifacts and dirt away from the place they are searching.

Skim shovels have a thin edge that helps the archeologists remove a thin layer of soil each time they scoop.

Trowels are used to scrape and cut to see different layers of soil.

What Archeologists Do While Working

      Archeologists have to be patient, so they won't be frustrated. If you are frustrated while working you won't get a lot of work done. They don't just zoom through their work, they take their time and handle the artifacts carefully. They use the tools I had listed earlier to uncover the artifacts they find. Once they find all the things they need they might take the artifacts to a museum,so that we can better understand the mysteries of the past.

An archeologist is a person who studies the history of our past. They dig up things underground from a long time ago and unlock our past.

              They used 3D computers that can track what's underground. Another team focuses on the actual digging and get far, and the place the team does the digging. It can take up to two weeks to dig a 25-square-foot section underground.

 

               They used tools like the pick and shovel,most digs start with these tools and get the digging started. The whisk and dustpan it's used to brush off  dirt from little pieces of artificial pieces. The Trowel was probably the most common tool archeologist used.

 

               So have you learned a lot about archeologists and what they do. They have a great job if we didn't have them we wouldn't have our past history.

A job of an archeologist is someone who discovers interesting artifacts from the past times. Archeologist can find interesting things of people that have vanished that might have did something great to change the world. An archeologist gets to learn about the history of someone if they didn't now anything about them. Some archeologist starts their dig with what are called skim shovels. These shovels are so small, flat and sharp that they can remove thin layers of soil, one at a time.

    

     That soil is then placed in a box with a half-inch screen at the bottom. This lets the dirt fall out while the artifacts stay in. The diggers also use a process called a troweling. Troweling is when archeologist use small shovels, paintbrushes and wooden picks to remove dirt from the artifacts that are found. It can take up two weeks to dig a 25-square foot section! Another team spends days in the lab studying the objects that are found. The whole process is slow and tiresome, but worth it.

 

     All the tools that are used by archeologist are the pick and shovel-most digs start with these two tools. Used to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts. Whisk and Dustpan- used to brush dirt off the artifcats and clear away dirt from the excavation site.

    

    

     There can be up to 35 people on a team! The first team maps the area using 3D computers that can track what is underground. The information is recorded so that the people will know what it looked like before people started digging. Archeologists are scientists that dig in the ground to find things called artifacts. Artifacts are the belongings of people that lived long ago, such as pottery, jewelry, and coins. Archeologists dig to find all things like that.

 

Archeologists use tools such as picks, shovels, Trowels, wheelbarrows, and knives. Archeologists use all of these tools for a different purpose, shovels to clear dirt, picks to clear rocks, wheelbarrows to move dirt, trowels to delicately remove dirt, and knives to clear dirt from artifacts.

 

Archeologists have a hard job they have to dig a very long time to find anything, normally. It takes Almost 2 weeks to dig a 25-square-foot hole, so it does, in-fact, take a lot of time. Digging for artifacts is very long process and you need to have enough strength to endure a lot of digging, as well as heat and sweat.

 

After artifacts are found the possessing team examines, cleans, and researches all the found artifacts and they either get thrown away or gets put in a museum.

                  In the Job of an archeologist you will learn about history by digging up, studying, and graphing famous places in history. now, you won't be doing all of this at once. The archeologist are broken up into teams. There can be up to thirty-five people on a team! The first team graphs and maps the area on three dimensional computers. How cool is that! The second team works on the actual digging. They start their digging with a tool called skim shovels. Skim shovels are flat, small, and sharp. Troweling is another process. Troweling is when archeologist use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove dirt from artifacts. When you are digging it can take up to two weeks to dig a twenty-five square-foot section! The other team spends days in the lab studying the artifacts. It takes a long time to figure out the story and reason for the artifact, but the outcome is huge!

Digging up the Past

 

 

               Have you ever wondered how archeologists ever found out about the artifacts of the past? Well, you have come to the right place! In this article, you will learn all about the study of artifacts, otherwise known as archeology. If you want to learn more about this marvelous art, then read on!

 

               First of all, it helps us learn all of the facts that may not be seen in biographies. This was stated in the article titled Digging up George Washington's Past, "Most of what we know of George Washington comes from his time as a soldier and president. Biographies don't have much information about his childhood. That's changing, however. Recent discoveries at Washington's childhood home have helped historians know more about Washington as a boy." This shows how by archeology we can find out more about historical people, landmarks and place. Due to this compelling quote it should be easy for one to see how important archeology is.

 

               Also, there are six essential tools to learn about before becoming a world class architect: {from Tools Used by Archeologists}

 


Pick and Shovel: This is used to dig into the earth in order to get close to artifacts.
Whisk and Dustpan: Together these are used to clear off dirt from artifacts and the excavation site.
Knife: Used for careful digging.
Wheelbarrow: To move items or carry away dirt.
Skim Shovel: To remove a thin layer of soil.
Trowel: To scrape and cut layers of soil.

 

                Last but not least, how do you practice the art of archeology. Well there are various methods but we will only cover there most basic ones today. There are three teams of people as large as 35 people. One team maps the area using 3 dimensional  computers to track the underground. Another team does the "real digging". The last team studies the artifacts that are found. Working together is very important in archeology.

 

 

               In my opinion, archeology must be fun and I would love to be an archeologist. All in all, archeology is a very important study. Maybe in the generations  of the generations of the future their will be technology to scan for artifacts and to analyze them. Who knows?

James Fort

 

     In 1994, historians began the Jamestown Rediscovery Archeology Project.  For 200 years people think that James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia had been washed away by a river. Because of some discoveries mad that might just be a myth.

    

     James Fort was built in 1607 when settlers or people came from England. You can see that in 1994 it would be had to recover these interesting artifacts. Not just historians but other people thought that it was built near a river, but objects that were found were in fact not at all close to the river. So these people figured that it would give more protection when enemy ships were near.

 

     The first objects found was not even in this century. They were found in 1861. The archeologists found armor and weapons.

The whisk and dust pan is to brush off dirt around the artifact or clean around the excavation site. The knife is used to scrape dirt from the artifacts . The wheelbarrow is to carry dirt away from the excavation site. The skim shovel is thin so it removes thin layers of soil. Finally, the trowel is used to scrape and cut different layers of soil.

I chose learning about the job of an archeologist and how they find or dig up history.

Many of history's mystery's are solved by archeologists. Their job is to find artifacts about how was it like in the past. One of their amazing discovery's they found was about George Washington and Fort James.

 

We all know about George Washington as a solider and a President but what about his childhood? Archeologists are finding more about Washington's childhood everyday. As we know it George lived on the property now know as Ferry Farm. His family moved there when he was just six years old. Four other houses have been build on Ferry Farm. Archeologists found burnt pottery in one of the houses, they are suggesting a fire might of occurred in the house. Along with the burnt pottery they found a clay pipe. We knew that Washington had smoked on a pipe. Now they know that this was Washington's House! We need to know about out ancestors in the past to build new items that can help us with the world today.

 

Now during that whole process of finding burnt pottery and Washington's clay pipe their is a team all behind it. Thirty-five people can be on a team and five teams each have work to do. The firsts team maps out  the area to see whats underground and what the artifacts on a 3D computer. The second team does the digging that is called a dig. This archeologist team uses skim shovels. Skim shovels are small, flat and sharp. Skim shovels are used to remove thin layers of soil. Each layer of soil goes in a small box with 1/2 of a screen at the bottom. The dirt falls out and if your lucky you can find a artifact.

 

Diggers also use another process or technique called troweling.The archeologists use paintbrushes. wooden picks and small shovels for troweling.When they are troweling it could take them up to two weeks to trowel a twenty-five-square foot section. Then another archeologist team is in a lab to find out what this artifact was used for and what can it do to help us in the modern world? Its a very long process but after all that hard work its worth it! Also architects use modern shovels, and a whisk and dustpan. you never know if your standing right on a artifact! Archeologists also use a knife to scrape of dirt off artifacts. Wheelbarrows are also useful for carrying dirt or artifacts.

 

Archeologists found another interesting artifacts at Fort James in Jamestown, Virginia, For over two hundred years people thought it had been washed away by the Pacific's ocean by its strong current and waves. But archeologists believe that there still might be some remains of the Fort. Fort James was built in 1607 where the settlers came to separate from England and start a new life. No wonder why they chose to set up a fort there. It was easy to dock ships, they thought the fort was located near the dock but near by artifacts that it was farther away that probably was a good idea so they could be hidden and protected by nearby or enemy ships. The items that indicate that it was farther away was in 1861 now about a hundred years later they started the search again.

 

After a five year study and learning how the land was used by National Park services they finally found Fort James! They set up pegs on the ground to show how big the fort was. With all the rumors, books, and drawings the archeologists made they found out the fort was shaped like a triangle. They also found out the top of the buildings ledges were for cannons. The archeologist also found that there were dozens of burial sites and ten buildings near Fort James. Each year the archeologists found a total of a million artifacts. They found tools, armor, weapons, coins, pottery even metal toys! This place was a natural gold mine for architects!

 

Today its very exciting to learn how people were back then. How they lived and survived through the night. How their childhood was or how they kept safe from enemies! Isn't it amazing how we are finding more and more about history everyday! Archeologist are looking for more historic artifacts today. Not just in the United States. There is still millions of artifacts that are needed to be found! So maybe when your older you can join the hunt!

Archeologists

                                          By Sarah Hoskin

     An archeologist is a person who studies objects from the past. Archeologists find objects by digging. First the archeloogists map the site where they will be digging using 3D computers. The place where they dig is called a dig. Next the archeologists start digging.  They start digging with small, flat, sharp shovels that can remove thin layers of soil one at a time. These shovels are called skim shovels. Next the archeologists put the soil in a box with a screen in the  bottom. The soil goes through the screen but the artifacts stay in the box. Next the archeologists remove dirt from the objects. The artifacts go to a lab where another team of archeologists study them.

     Archeologists use many tools to do their job. These tools are a pick and shovel, a whisk and dustpan, a knife, a wheelbarrow, a skim shovel, and a trowel. A pick and shovel are used to dig close to the artifacts. A whisk and dustpan are used to brush dirt off the artifacts. A knife is used to scrape dirt off the artifacts. A wheelbarrow is used to move things and dirt from one place to another. A skim shovel is used to remove a layer of soil wiht each scoop and a trowel is used to cut the soil to view different layers of soil.

     Archeologists help us learn about the past and how peopole in the past lived. They also help us learn more about the lives of famous peopole that lived in the past. Being an archeologist is a very interesting job.

My Report   

 

     Hello, do you won't to be an archeologist?. well if you do you would like the idea after you read this. A job of an archeologist is very fun because let me tell you that archeologist found things that were in George Washington's house years ago, but how did they find all of those things years ago. This is how. The process of digging at the Ferry Farm is a careful one.

 

     First and foremost, Each year, many teams will work on the site. There can be up to 35 archeologist on a team! The first team maps the area using 3D computers that can track what is underground. The imformation is recorded so that people will know what it looked like before people started digging. Another team focuses on the actual digging, and the place the team does the digging is called the dig.

 

      Secondly, Tose archeologists start their dig with what are called skim shovels. These shovels are so small, flat, and sharp that can remove thin layers of soil, one at a time. That soil is then placed in a box with a half-inch screen at the bottom. This let's the dirt fall out while the artifacts stay in. The diggers also use a process called troweling. Troweling is when archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove dirt.

 

      Third, It can take up to two weeks to dig a 25-square-foot section! Another team spends days in the lab studying the objects that are found. The whole process is slow and tiresome, but it's worth it. This means that the discovery of washington's home is important for many reasons. First, it gives the citizens of the United States a better understanding of who George Washington was before he became fomous. We also begin to know why he made the decisions he did. Another thing it does is help historians learn about the type of Colonial Americans lived. All of these things are key parts of our past as Americans.

 

      Fourth, Ferry Farm offers many opportunities for kids to get involved. The George Washington society runs summer workshops with both classroom and outdoor activities. Kids can explore the site, experience colonial life, and become junior archeologists. Kids can sign up for classes, games, and crafts. There is even an interactive website! It challenges kids to solve puzzles about the work being done at the Ferry Farm.

 

       Fifth, The tools that archeoloigists use are the Pick and the Shovel, the Whisk and the Dustpan, The Knife, The Wheel Barrow, The Skim Shovel, and the Trowel. The Pick and the Shovel are use to start digs. they are used to dig into the earth, close to the artifact. The Whisk and the Dustpan are used to brush dirt off the artifacts and clear away dirt from the excavation site. The Knife is used for careful digging and to scrape dirt from around the artifacts. The Wheelbarrow is used to move items from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the excavation site. The Skim shovel is a shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil wit each scoop. And the Trowel is probaly the most common tool in archeology. It is used to scrape and cut to view the different layrs of soil.

 

      Last but not least, People have lived on the land known as the Ferry Farm for over 12,000 years. It's location makes it a perfect place to build a home. Therefore, it's not surprising that George Washington's father, Augustine Washington, moved his family there. George was just six years old at the time. No one knew exactly where the Washington home was long gone. However, archeologists believed that the stone base under the house was still there.

 

              Digging around in dirt can give you more than just dusty jeans. The folks at the Ferry Farm are bringing to life the country's first president in ways we have never seen.

Archeologists

     Archeologists are people who study the past.  Archaeologists discover objects from the past, and they are scientists.  Being an archeologist takes time and patience.  Some clues are the pottery that the Americans made long ago.  You could also get clues from the trash and objects that they used!  Pottery is they most likely way to find ancient artifacts.  You could also find marks on the ground and find the place where it all began.  The artifacts that the archeologists find are important are a big part of our past.                

 

 

     The way archeologists dig up the past is that they have 3 teams and they all have different jobs.  There could be up to 35 members on a team!  The first team maps the area using a 3D computer so that they can track what is underground.  Then the information is recorded so that people can know what they are looking for. 

 

     The second team starts the digging, the place the team digs at is called a dig.  The archeologists start their dig with a tool called skim shovels, which is a shovel with a flat edge used to carefully get off a thin layer of soil.  These shovels are flat, small, and sharp.  Then that soil is placed in a box with a 1/2 inch screen at the bottom.  This lets the dirt fall out and lets the artifacts stay in. 

 

     The diggers also use a process called troweling.  That is when archeologists use small shovels, paint brushes, and wooden picks to remove the dirt.  Another team spends days in the lab studying the artifacts that are found.  The reason some people stay in the lab is because that analyze the artifacts, they find out how old it is, they find out who used it, and they fin out who made it so thay can have more information on the object or person they are finding more about.  

 

     Some of the tools used by the archeologists to discover these ancient artifacts are picks and shovels which are used to dig into the earth, close to the artifacts.  A whisk and a dustpan are used to clear the dirt away from the artifacts.  A knife is used for careful digging and to scrape the dirt around the sides of the artifact.  A wheelbarrow is used to move items from one place to another or to carry dirt away from the digging site.  A skim shovel, as I explained in the other passage, is a shovel with a flat edge used to carefully remove a thin layer of soil.  A trowel is probably the most commonly used tool in archeology.  It is use to scrape and cut to view the different layers of soil.  These tools are used every day to discover the precious artifacts.

 

     An archeologists job is long, tiresome, and hard.  They must take their time or they might miss and important clue of fact.  It can take up to two weeks to dig up a 25-square-foot section!  All of the weeks you are working adds up when you are working to dig up a large space.  It also takes up time to dig up the important information and artifacts.  Archeologists must have patience to really discover, enjoy, and appreciate the true meaning to be and archeologist.

 

    

     Without archeologists we wouldn't know anything about our past and we would be clueless about the people who came before us.  Archeologists give us proof that there were people who came before us, they give us a better understanding of what tools they used back then, and they give us a picture of what their life was like.  This is what makes the archeologist's job so amazing and interesting. What would we do without our archeologists?

Archeologists

 

                                                     Tools

 

Archeologists use picks and shovels to start out a dig. They use whisks and dustpans for cleaning off dirt that's loose on the artifact. They use the knife for digging around the artifact. They use the wheelbarrow for carrying things around.

 

I want to be friends with a archeologist it will be fun to learn what he does.

How  archeologists find their information

 

They first have to know what their looking for they have to  get their information and what they need. Then when they went what they were looking for.

 

 

If it was underground they would probably use a wheelbarrow and move stuff to another place they might be looking for history.

 

 

Then when they found it they would probably show it to a museum or somewhere else.

 

 

 That's how archeologists find their information.

There are many artifacts yet to be found on this planet. But the question is, who is going to find it? This is the job of an archaeologist. They have to first find a location, look for the artifacts, and then transport the artifacts to scientists to see what they mean and why they are significant. A lot of tough work!

     

      So to even find artifacts, the archaeologists need to find where to look for. A good place would be a place that is really old, like a sixteenth century mansion, or a cave used by cavemen. After they have targeted their location, they need to get to the location and begin looking around for good places to dig and work on.

 

      After they perfect spot is located, here comes the toughest job that may take weeks or even months. The digging is the most significant part of an archaeologist's job and life. So first, you use a trowel and a skim shovel to get the sand or ground away. Then they use the pick and shovel and start searching for artifacts. And when they hear a CLINK! they use their knife for careful digging. The hard work is complete!

 

      Then comes the transportation. After people have taken out the artifact from the ground, light artifacts are usually given to scientists by hand. But when the artifacts are dense and heavy, archaeologists use a wheel barrow to transpot the artifacts. After the archaeologists have transported the artifacts to the scientists, the job is done!

 

       As you can see, being an archaeologist requires a lot of work. It is not a job that can be taken by ease. But the good part is when you found the artifact and just revealed a mystery.

The Archeologists work !

                                                                 By: Chardonnay

 

 

 

 

   In 1994 lot of people was interested in studying the past. The people that studied the past started the Jamestown Rediscovery Archaeological Project. The design was to discover the secrets and mysteries and the past of James Fort in Jamestown, Virginia. For many years, people thought that the fort had been washed away by a river. A little bit if discoveries  in the area hinted that it might still be around. The fort was built in 1607 when people came from England to begin a new life. A lot people believed that James Fort was built near the river. However, objects found nearby suggested the fort was located further away. The spot probably gave the people move protection from mean ships. The first objects were found in 1861. archeologists, the name for scientists who study things from the past. The people who study things use computer mapping software to make images of the area. That's when they finally found James Fort ! The first thing they found was a set of marks. The set of marks showed where the forts walls used to be.

 

   

    The objects include pottery, tools, coins, and even metal toys for the children. In 1600's people used to throw their trash down an unused well or into a bid pit. While digging in the area the archeologists found the trash the settlers threw away, including bones of animals ate. The information learned from these objects helps us understand how the people in James Fort lived. Now the archeologists now know how the settlers fought Powhatan tribe that often attacked them. The archeologists also know what the settlers did to survive the difficult years when they had little food.

 

 

     The archeologists think it is exciting to discover objects that were regularly used by people who lived hundreds of years ago. The archeologists say it gives them a piece of their past and ties them to the people who first started the American colonies.

 

 

     The archeologists also found eleven cellars, dozens of burial sites, and ten buildings all within the border of the fort.The National Park Service led a five-year study of the area to figure out how the land was used. They knew that this would help them decide where to look for proof the fort.
